name: Blended Scotch TB-BSW6 Year Old Thompson Bros
characters: Figs, Sultana, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Toffee, Coffee
nose: Plum sauce, miso, golden sultanas, cinder toffee and coffee crème patissiere
palate: Golden sultanas, raisin loaf, buttered Jamaica cake, maple and toasted cinnamon
finish: Soft warm spice; allspice, nutmeg and cinnamon, with orange peel and dried figs
reviews: Stunning stuff for the money, might well be my new house dram. Soft, beautifully textural with restrained sherry sweetness. || This is great value for money if you’re looking for a regular sipper at a great price . 46%, natural colour and non chill filtered. I ‘ll definitely be being another bottle. || This is super. Tried it with a friend and had a blind tasting of 4 other drams. This came out tops. Even knocked the socks off 3 Islay malts. In our tasting. || Excellent balanced dram. One of best, new generation blended whiskies on the market, a must try. NK || Great value for a rich tasting scotch. Love it. || Forced to write a review having taken a punt and bought a bottle as a regular inexpensive "sipper". Usually Naked Grouse fills this space in my cabinet, which I find terrific value, and usually can get for near enough £20, and hits those sherry malty notes I find quaffable. However TB/BSW is a far superior product. Very sherried and thick treacle, hitting many of the notes as a GlenAllachie 15, and at half the price. Non chill filtered and no colour added to boot. This really is a great addition to any collection for a fan of big sherry cask influence, with great depth of flavour and complexity, and in my view unrivalled value for money in the sub £35 level. || Excellent liquid and great value! || Reputedly from Edrington stock this is a lovely sherry bomb of a blend. The grain is almost  imperceptible, this tastes more like a classic Speyside sherried malt with all the Xmas cake vibes that entails. After a while open oxidation resulted in a sulphur note that came to dominate proceedings a little so if you're sensitive to that you may wish to swerve this one (minus a star for that). However overall value is excellent!
flavour_note: Figs, Sultana, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Toffee, Coffee Plum sauce, miso, golden sultanas, cinder toffee and coffee crème patissiere Golden sultanas, raisin loaf, buttered Jamaica cake, maple and toasted cinnamon Soft warm spice; allspice, nutmeg and cinnamon, with orange peel and dried figs

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label
characters: Rose, Hazelnut, Honey, Smoke, Dark Chocolate, Tobacco
nose: Smooth, silky cereal, syrupy flapjacks, polished oak. Dessicated coconut, then other nutty notes: unsalted peanut, brazil nut.
palate: A silky caress. Unexpectedly strong spicy entry, but always honeyed and rounded by some toasty oak. The honeyed malt is beautifully interwoven around the venerable grain, which must be absolutely ancient.
finish: A perfectly-integrated slow fade of the palate. Mouthwatering grain, and the honey and spices dwindle slowly. Extremely long but still very gentle.
reviews: Un elixir. || Excellent Whisky. Smooth on the palate, easy to drink and exceptionally good. || Not worth the price. Bought it due to all the hype surrounding it and was disappointed. I would prefer a bottle of single malts such as Glenfiddich over it.
flavour_note: Rose, Hazelnut, Honey, Smoke, Dark Chocolate, Tobacco Smooth, silky cereal, syrupy flapjacks, polished oak. Dessicated coconut, then other nutty notes: unsalted peanut, brazil nut. A silky caress. Unexpectedly strong spicy entry, but always honeyed and rounded by some toasty oak. The honeyed malt is beautifully interwoven around the venerable grain, which must be absolutely ancient. A perfectly-integrated slow fade of the palate. Mouthwatering grain, and the honey and spices dwindle slowly. Extremely long but still very gentle.

name: The Big Ben
nose: Medium weight, malty nose, with hints of orange peel.
palate: Medium depth, hints of smokiness and sweetness, round and smooth on palate.
reviews: Very pleased with the whiskey. Highly recommend
flavour_note: Medium weight, malty nose, with hints of orange peel. Medium depth, hints of smokiness and sweetness, round and smooth on palate. Elegant finish.

name: J&B Rare
reviews: Very nice || Was delighted to find this whisky and at a very reasonable price from the Whisky Exchange. I bought it for my son's birthday, it's his favourite, he was delighted. I was disappointed I couldn't find J and B in a litre bottle, had to settle for 70cl || Have always considered this to be the best, but it is very difficult to find in any shops || a beautiful scotch not overwhealming, but a lingering flavour sadly not available as it used to be

name: Dimple 15 Year OldLitre
flavour_note: Caramel, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Dark Chocolate

name: Dimple Gold Selection
reviews: Great whiskey,at a bargain price. Smooth on the palate,rich taste || I bought this as an alternative to Haig original. It has the Haig notes I remember, but sadly was too infused with caramel for me to truly enjoy it.

name: Johnnie Walker Swing
nose: Complex and sophisticated with almost perfumed sweetness. Unquestionably soft and accessible, you are sure to notice the fanciful vanilla and sherry-cask wood notes wafting through.
palate: Smooth and sweet. But its light freshness cloaks a deeper fruitiness, with some smoke and restrained flavors lingering beyond.
finish: A lengthy and rich finish, reverberating with sweetness, completes the movement.
reviews: Certainly overpriced for what it is -- I pick up a fair bit of Cardhu malt on the palate, so if that's a whisky to your liking, you'll enjoy Swing. It's an effortlessly inoffensive blend, nicely balanced and integrated. Nothing really stands out (apart from the glorious nose), but nothing upsets, either. Frightfully easy to drink, tasty, but once again, a bit too bruising to the wallet. My bottles are from pre-2009, so YMMV with the more contemporary bottlings. || I have tried SWING and really liked it. Its taste was outstanding and compares with JW Blue, and I really thought nothing could compare to JW Blue. || I was bought a bottle for a birthday present and not being a whiskey drinker I was very surprised to find only half a bottle left the next morning!! Count me as a convert || Of all the Johnnies, this is the goto swig. || "Nose" (undiluted) Invitingly floral with gentle sherry notes, followed by a wisp of smoke. Malty too. "Palate" (undiluted) Sweet wild honey smeared on dark toast. Light sherry notes (think dark red fruit) make an appearance before a transition to spiced vanilla and butterscotch. "Finish" (undiluted) Sherry still there. Some oak comes to the forefront before fading to a final dark red fruit note (due to the sherry influence) .
flavour_note: Complex and sophisticated with almost perfumed sweetness. Unquestionably soft and accessible, you are sure to notice the fanciful vanilla and sherry-cask wood notes wafting through. Smooth and sweet. But its light freshness cloaks a deeper fruitiness, with some smoke and restrained flavors lingering beyond. A lengthy and rich finish, reverberating with sweetness, completes the movement.

name: Chivas Regal 12 Year Old
characters: Honey, Vanilla, Apple, Pear, Butterscotch, Heather
reviews: Very mundane. Not bad but far from good. Its got a bite which doesn't bother me of it has a smooth finish. It does not. I can't detect notes of anything like a Speyside is known for no fruit or toffee or anything. And I don't disdain a good Blended Scotch. This just ain't in the toppins. || The worst whiskey I have ever tasted. Yes, someone might call it smooth, but it completely lacks any distinguishing flavors, no character! I really don't know how it can be so popular all over the world. In my opinion, ?ther 12 year old blends like Dewars 12 and Grants 12 are much better with more distinguished aromas and taste. I won't give this even to my worst enemy. || Disgusting all burn and a big blast of alcohol not even worth £ 1 . Had to give 1 star or review not accepted otherwise would give it minus 5 stars .probably not even useful as drain cleaner! || The nose is stewed fruits, mainly apple, red and green. Not much else after that. Same for the taste. Nice and sweet with white pepper at the end. Good price for it though. || Wow fab
flavour_note: Honey, Vanilla, Apple, Pear, Butterscotch, Heather

name: Te Bheag
reviews: re review last time in my review i said awsome well balanced witch i was referring to the te bheag and not to the Glenfidish 12 , right now just finished pouring myself a second wee dram and again a hidden gem its like walking on the beach and breating in that sea salt air. sweet and relaxed. || I'm a single-malt guy, but I tried this many years ago while sharing a friend's birthday cake and it blew me away. Years later I continue to be impressed by its warmth and complexity. It was great value for the money back then and, thankfully, still is! || awsome well balanced just finished a wee dram of glenfidish 12 this is by far way better more complex || Yes - bought some whilst staying in Skye - fabulous blend that I have never found anything to match. I have recommended to many friends but had to stop as there was none left on the shelves! || While traveling in Scotland I purchased a bottle at the distillery. I fell in love with it. My girlfriend was suffering from a cold but doesn't drink whiskey. She took a dram, then a second and loved it. Tried to find it in the US but they couldn't import it back then.

name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old
nose: Soft and complex with touches of toasted oak, honey, coconut, and figs.
palate: Spicy with a nice allspice note on top and caramel syrup sweetness underneath.
finish: Hints of lemon-lime citrus develop later, and last through the long finish.
reviews: Johnnie Walker Black Label is one of the iconic blends. If you're a beginner- this is a whisky you should try. Before JWB I tried basic versions of JW, Grant's, Ballantine's. To me JWB was on a different level of complexity. This is not a single malt but it has a very smooth, consistent taste, I get notes of tobacco, oak, some grass, smoky finish. Great on ice or with a bit of water. || Really enjoyed this for a while until it started to give me an after taste of soap. Put me off it after that || Boring, flat and bland. Truly unremarkable. || I wanted to like this, but it's really just all a bit flat. You can tell that the flavours are there but they are so reduced to make this all a bit bland, unfortunately. It could really do with a couple of more points on the alcohol percentage. There is a bit of smoke and a bit of toffee and a bit of oil on the tongue, just not enough of any of those factors. Don't add ice or water, any flavour that is there will be nullified. Maybe I'm being harsh coming from some of the big single malt flavours, but I'm always interested in what the blenders can do. I bought this on offer, to contradict myself, I'll keep it to mix with cola and ice, or even IRN BRU. || I want to rate this three stars, but as soon as you’re out for dinner somewhere that doesn’t have a good selection of scotch JWB becomes a five star expression. Probably the best feature is the perfect 50/50 blend of Islay peat smoke and charred oak barrel smoke. Though, I’m still not a fan of the heavy peatedness. And would prefer the oak char only. Nevertheless, on a lot of ice as it is served in bars and restaurants, this totally hits the spot. It’s completely reliable. For the price, this is impossible to beat. Very good blend of sweet, vanilla, leather and peppered tannins. There really isn’t anything else available that is this versatile. Definitely nothing at this price.
flavour_note: Cream, Toffee, Dried Fruit, Smoke Soft and complex with touches of toasted oak, honey, coconut, and figs. Spicy with a nice allspice note on top and caramel syrup sweetness underneath. Hints of lemon-lime citrus develop later, and last through the long finish.

name: Maclean's Nose Blended Scotch Whisky
characters: Peat smoke, Brine, Lemon, Bread, Malt
reviews:
Fantastic value for money. A great 'Basic' whisky. || Splendid dramming, high malt content.  A very good  tribute to charles  McLean/ argyle peninsula. || Bought this at the distillery. The only whisky (so far) that I had to say "wow!" when tasting. || exellent bargain . better than a lot of malts twice the price. || I can highly recommend this, its a beautiful dram and full of flavour. i'm half way through my bottle and still have to try it with a drop of H2o.
its  great tasting whisky which could easily be mistaken as a single malt
flavour_note: Peat smoke, Brine, Lemon, Bread, Malt

name: Hankey Bannister Original
reviews: Thoroughly enjoyed it. Nice taste and smell. Not too harsh on the throat, but lovely with a splash of water and a clink or two of ice. Obviously not like a single malt, but drinkable non the less. I will buy again. || Not the worst whisky I have, but I don't like it. It smells OK - honey/caramel switness combined with a fair amount of alcohol and spice. But the teste is disappointing despite the layering. It has spice, a hint of smoke and fruits, but also a dark char and oil notes (in a bed way, like engine oil). Oak opens up in the finish but it quickly disappears leaving you with great amount of alcohol that anesthetized all around in your mouth. Overal, It was an interesting expericence but the next time I'd like to taste a scotch I'll definitely will take someting else in about the same price category. || One of the best whiskies I've had the pleasure of trying || The worst whisky I have ever had the misfortune of drinking. || Not a bad blend for the price at my local store in Taipei.

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Diwali EditionThe Whisky Exchange Exclusive Bottle
characters: Toffee, Honey, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Vanilla, Almond
flavour_note: Toffee, Honey, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Vanilla, Almond

name: Johnnie Walker Sweet Peat
food_paring: Fish And Chips, Bbq Ribs, Roasted Aubergine
reviews: very enjoyable dram def give it a go || Huge fan of Black & Green Label (the latter hugely underrated), but came across this blend by chance. Really impressed. The balance of the smoke & sweat is great - I suspect Caol Ila is the star here. Lovely notes of caramel & fudge. || The Sweet Peat was a very nice and delicate scotch the peat was suttle and the maltiness was sweet toffee-like with a hint of fruit, apricots. It was very smooth and everything unique about it would fade quickly as you notice it to show other complexities about it. || A lovely blend. Very little peat on the nose but a delightful blend of sherry and peat on the palate all the way through to the finish. A fine addition to the JW brand. || Bought this on a trip to your Covent Garden shop in January and cracked it open on recently. Superb and without a doubt one of the finest blends I've tried. Highly recommended.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Caramel, Smoke, Lemon, Grass

name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label ReserveGlass Set
reviews: Hi my partner loved the products i bought from you, he is a collector of the Johnnie walker products and has not opened the products i have bought him, he is extremely happy with adding to his collection though, i've had such an amazing experience with use even with the time difference and as my order was around the queen passing away, you were all very punctual and amazing with all the responses i received will definitely buy from use again.

name: Isle of Skye 12 Year Old Blended Whisky
characters: Apricot, Dark Chocolate, Peat smoke, Gooseberry
flavour_note: Apricot, Dark Chocolate, Peat smoke, Gooseberry

name: Cutty Sark Prohibition
reviews: Great stuff, very enjoyable || Prohibition blend as I always called it, the perfect mellow taste is awesome, on the rocks as I prefer. I recommend it among my friends which they also enjoy it. || Nose: Coconut, vanilla Palate: Creamy, Oily, sweet Finish: Slightly peppery (not astringent or harsh), mouth-watering I sincerely hope they don’t stop making this, I don’t have an alternative that’s this good at this price point (or even a little higher.) || No big fancy words and descriptions which mean absolutely nothing when describing whisky.Trust me,ive been drinking whisky for 30 years and the only way to decide if you like a particular one is to try it yourself.All i can tell you is that I really like this,particularly at the price || I haven't received it yet?

name: Grand Old Parr 12 Year OldLitre
characters: Caramel, Stewed Fruit, Lemon, Orange, Peat smoke, Raisins
flavour_note: Caramel, Stewed Fruit, Lemon, Orange, Peat smoke, Raisins

name: Ballantine's Finest True Music Icons Elton John Edition
flavour_note: Malt, Apple, Honeysuckle, Honeycomb, Pear

name: Ballantine's Finest
reviews: Ballantine's Finest is quite light, floral with short finish, not much smoke.  Personally not my taste but this is a good mixer. || Ballentines blended whisky is second to none for peaty smokiness, a strong taste of chocolate & blackberries on ghe pallett.  It has an aromatic nose with a surprisingly subtle aftertaste of lemon. || Higher standard of supermarket whiskeys.  Not to sharp or bitter. Quite smooth. A fruity and butterscotch taste on the palate, but looses something on the back end. Decent entry level whiskey. Can't complain with what you get for the price || Nice and smooth. Beautiful whiskey for the price. || The first Scotch I been drinking as a student in clubs. But even than I tasted to much on ethanol  and had a kind of acetone finish. Two ice cubes, or sip of soda, or Cola, would make it better.  Still, I always have it in home bar. It still tastes better than JW Red. For my taste Teacher's is best in this price range.
flavour_note: Malt, Caramel, Smoke, Toffee, Apple

name: Cutty Sark 12 Year Old
characters: Clove, Ginger, Dried Fruit, Marmalade, Pineapple, Salt (powder)
reviews: Such a good whisky, lovely fruity fresh flavours, with a depth that reveals more - a leading whisky and thoroughly recommended at a bargain price
flavour_note: Clove, Ginger, Dried Fruit, Marmalade, Pineapple, Salt (powder)

name: Johnnie Walker Double Black
characters: Smoke, Oak, Tar, Honey, Apple, Sultana
nose: Fairly light but oily, with dry oak, honey and gently stony smoke.
palate: The flavour is full bodied and complex with the signature Johnnie Walker peat smoke shining brightly through rich raisins and sultanas. Apples, pears and orange zest bring freshness while creamy vanilla and spice bring a softness and sweetness to the tongue.
finish: The long warming finish combines spicy oak tannins and lingering smoke.
reviews: One of my favourite. || Bought it on special here in Australia. Good to drink after a day at work, the oakiness at the finish is worth the 30 quid I paid for it. || 100% satisfaction with any Johnnie Walker whiskey. Gold reserve still remains a firm leader though || It is a great whisky, it is like a less smooth JW Black Label with more smoke, not my first choice but excellent nontheless. || It is a very smooth and delicious whisky
flavour_note: Smoke, Oak, Tar, Honey, Apple, Sultana Fairly light but oily, with dry oak, honey and gently stony smoke. The flavour is full bodied and complex with the signature Johnnie Walker peat smoke shining brightly through rich raisins and sultanas. Apples, pears and orange zest bring freshness while creamy vanilla and spice bring a softness and sweetness to the tongue. The long warming finish combines spicy oak tannins and lingering smoke.

name: Pig's Nose
reviews:
Very smooth and damm nice. || yes, for a non whisky drinker having tried over a dozen or so pigs nose is as described.
a smooth soft finish yet still has the sting on the lips and gums of a spirit making you know your drinking a proper whisky. Whould def consider buying a bottle, || Pleasant, malty, sweetish, smooth, easy-going. Try it from your coffee cup - short, black, Ethiopia, for example. Very nice! || Young, earthy and sweet, easy drinking whisky || This is just an easy dram. It may not be the most refined spirit but, but it’s comforting to enjoy.

name: Ballantine's Finest True Music Icons Queen Edition
characters: Heather, Honey, Cinnamon, Clove, Milk Chocolate, Apple
reviews: I bought this as a gift for my partner who is a massive Queen fan. It won't be drunk, but displayed with his collection.
flavour_note: Heather, Honey, Cinnamon, Clove, Milk Chocolate, Apple

name: Bell's Original
characters: Mixed Herb, Malt, Heather, Honey, Oak
reviews: Smashing || Seriously, if you drink Scotch and Dry Ginger Ale, this is the prefect mixer!  Why pay any more? || Surprised by how much I enjoyed a dram of Bell's when I tried it for the first time in a long time recently...really enjoyed the smoky, fruity, malty flavours.  Everyone has their own palate and taste and this works for me, especially after a cold walk over the hills on a rainy day. || Pleasantly surprised. I usually drink single malts - Macallan Gold a favourite - but recently thought I'd revisit some of the blended whiskeys I drank many years ago. Haven't drank Bells since the 70s and wasn't expecting too much. But I am actually enjoying it. Certainly excellent value for money. But one mans meat is another mans poison. || Have had it before in England is to the reason I ordered it. Still waiting for my shipment to arrive.
flavour_note: Mixed Herb, Malt, Heather, Honey, Oak

name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
nose: Honey, vanilla cream, sherry-style dried fruits and notes of biscuits.
palate: Luxuriously smooth, creamy and delicately honeyed with lingering waves of wood, fruit and light, sweet smoke. A multi-layered blend of sweet fruits and creaminess that evokes deeper honey tones.
finish: Lingering waves of wood and light west-coast smoke.
food_paring: Fish And Chips, Dim Sum, Turkey
reviews: Very good . So happy with it, that I will not exite to place another order when my finances improves. || This with the 18 offer the best value in the range. One of the smoothest whiskies you can buy, with nice traces of toffee, dried fruit (sherry)and hint of smoke from the malt. Made with Clynelish has more depth than the thinner tasting black label. Hence it costs more. But still a good price. Most will struggle not to like this. || Robust nose, fairly full palate. However the finish is bitter - and not very pleasantly so. I believe Black Label is a better choice for the price, and Green Label infinitely better. || This tastes great but doesn't smell very good. The blenders need to make a change or two. The old Gold Label that was an 18 year old was in a different league. || Excellent very smooth . It’s that good my wife drinks it all and she doesn’t like whisky.
flavour_note: Caramel, Honeysuckle, Vanilla, Butterscotch, Smoke Honey, vanilla cream, sherry-style dried fruits and notes of biscuits. Luxuriously smooth, creamy and delicately honeyed with lingering waves of wood, fruit and light, sweet smoke. A multi-layered blend of sweet fruits and creaminess that evokes deeper honey tones. Lingering waves of wood and light west-coast smoke.

name: Whyte & Mackay Triple Matured
reviews: Good whiskey at a very good price. I take it with a splash of sparkling water. || Very good entry level. Transition from sweet to bitter good length and lasts long time after left mouth. I'm not into peat! Doesn't need water. Good room temperature. || For the price, this was very tasty and drinkable. I was surprised that it was very drinkable neat and on the rocks, whereas others in the same price range were not (JW Red, for example). Very good value for money. || Very smooth and tasty!! || It's a lovely drink!

name: John Walker & Sons King George V
nose: Profound smoky initial aroma followed by sweet, fresh fruit (apples, pears, bananas) malt characteristics; developing into rich dried fruit/spicy complexity (raisins, figs, cinnamon).
palate: Smooth with a rich, fruity sweetness. Warming with subtle flavours of sandalwood and smoke.
finish: Mouthwarming and lingering rich peaty finish.
reviews: Bought this for my dad's 80th birthday. He's been a scotch drinker his adult life. He's tasted some fine scotch in his time. He would break out the bottle of Blue on special occasions. When he tasted this, he closed his eyes, grinned, and said "that is the nicest tasting scotch whiskey I've ever had". Me too. || Wow! || The best you can try || Taste of heaven || Johnny Walker has only the best. Plus King George was my 2nd Great Grandfather so to have a bottle named after my ancestor is a treat indeed. Thank you for remembering my family.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Toffee, Honey, Salt (powder), Oak Profound smoky initial aroma followed by sweet, fresh fruit (apples, pears, bananas) malt characteristics; developing into rich dried fruit/spicy complexity (raisins, figs, cinnamon). Smooth with a rich, fruity sweetness. Warming with subtle flavours of sandalwood and smoke. Mouthwarming and lingering rich peaty finish.

name: Famous Grouse
reviews: This is my go to whiskey, lovely peaty smell,well balanced,with a hint of smoke,most enjoyable tasting blend,would recommend to any whiskey lover, || Grainy, young and sweet blended scotch . Like to know which distilleries supply the chain to blend this saturated whisky demand. Enjoy as a mixer/ cocktail . As neat OK for the price of £16. || Simply a classic. The proletariat everyday blended Scotch that's kept me warm many a winter night. || The only whisky I will have.. After the evening meal and end of the day what better that a famous grouse || In my opinion one of the best low price blends around. It's balanced offering a bit of everything, in nose the candy fruit and the vanilla are predominant over a wood basis and a smoke hint, in mouth is sweet, more caramel than vanilla, the oak improved its presence and in the end you can actually note the sherry cask which is a superb plus at this price. A good and economic choice to share with friends or for a crowded party instead the usual blends.

name: Cutty Sark
reviews: Great for everyday aperitif. I tried it iced and with club soda but overall I prefer it with just a dram of tap water. This is when the flavor of the brew comes through the best, as far as I'm concerned. || I Have personally tried Cuttys 35 year old scotch it was in a decanter bottle Waterford crystal I believe in a mahogany case I only wish I could come across that another bottle this was back in 1985 || this is the best blended scotch for the money ,,,irresistible and seamless blend of flavors that are clear and easy to distinguish... || Fantastic whiskey, first seen the brand while watching Goodfellas & again more recently was mentions in series 3 of the new Cobra Kai! A man’s man drink || Tried it straight today, will have to mix it to see if i am able to get thru the bottle without dumping it. Taste is good but the entry nose is too sickening sweet and comes back as an aftertaste. I prefer j&b.

name: Royal Salute 21 Year Old Signature Blend
Johnnie Walker Red Label
nose: Hints of fresh apple, pear and the spark of zest from the elegant Speyside malts.
palate: Fruity sweetness, cinnamon and pepper crackling on the centre of your tongue.
finish: A sophisticated, smoky finish - the signature of all Johnnie Walker blends.
reviews: Johnnie Walker Red Label is a great mixer, especially with coke. Quite light with a smoky finish, you can try it with ice. Good beginner and party whisky. || A good whiskey for beginners, light and smooth yet delicious. || I like it. Haven't tried it in years, but went back out of necessity, and it is smooth, has peat, and it's sweet/creamy. If this is ur style, then this is the best budget scotch I have found, and I've tried them all. It is cheaper than Wild Turkey 101 where I am and easier to find. I think it's less harsh, too. || Always fancied trying red label as I liked black label so much. No complaints I really like it would recommend.
flavour_note: Hints of fresh apple, pear and the spark of zest from the elegant Speyside malts. Fruity sweetness, cinnamon and pepper crackling on the centre of your tongue. A sophisticated, smoky finish - the signature of all Johnnie Walker blends.

name: Compass Box Glasgow Blend
characters: Fruit Cake, Salt (powder), Smoke, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Nutmeg
reviews: Wonderful. Light to medium smoke with a sherry bomb finish. Rich and smooth.
flavour_note: Fruit Cake, Salt (powder), Smoke, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Nutmeg

name: J&B 15 Year Old ReserveLitre
characters: Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Apple, Oak, Smoke
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Apple, Oak, Smoke

name: Isle of Skye 8 Year Old Blended Whisky
nose: Stunningly evocative. Deep peaty tones waft from the glass, like the reek from a crofter’s lum. But there is a lot more beyond: the grains intermingle deliciously with oaky, vanilla notes and something malty and even slightly honeyed. The stuff of dreams.
palate: Sweet at first, and remarkably viscous. This seems to be the peat hanging around and there is intense barley sugar and spice.
reviews: This is a lot like a swift-finishing and watered down Speyside. It's very delicate and doesn't offend like a lot of cheap blends do. Pretty nice nose actually. It actually seems pretty malt heavy. The finish and watery tones to this leave a lot to be desired, though. One of the quickest finishes I've had this year. It is still phenominal for a blend and drinks like a cheap single malt.
flavour_note: Heather, Seashell, Toffee, Wildflowers Stunningly evocative. Deep peaty tones waft from the glass, like the reek from a crofter’s lum. But there is a lot more beyond: the grains intermingle deliciously with oaky, vanilla notes and something malty and even slightly honeyed. The stuff of dreams. Sweet at first, and remarkably viscous. This seems to be the peat hanging around and there is intense barley sugar and spice.

name: Ballantine's 21 Year Old
characters: Honey, Cinnamon, Apple, Dried Fruit, Honeysuckle, Oak
reviews:
I enjoyed this bottle very much.
Smokey nose with a hint of peat. Quite an intense flavour but morish at fhe same time.
Perfect with  côte de boeuf or a rare T-bone steak. || Doesn’t disappoint. Surprisingly full in the mouth for a standard strength dram. Sweet and rich. A counterpoint to the prevailing obsession with single malts.
flavour_note: Honey, Cinnamon, Apple, Dried Fruit, Honeysuckle, Oak

name: Chivas Regal 18 Year OldGift Box
reviews: Almost the perfect Scotch. Smooth as silk with no firey aftertaste, Really cannot fault it. just remember to put the top back on the bottle. . . || If a blend can be described in one word it would be Outstanding. On the nose it's subtle aroma fills you up with flavors of sweet oranges, red apples, plump raisins and figs. On the palate it's a wonderful confluence of all the above bodied into a Christmas cake with a very light hint of cinnamon and cappuccino. Marvelous is the word that comes to mind on the very first sip. The first time I had it with a friend we polished the whole bottle off. Since then it has never left my cabinet
flavour_note: Wildflowers, Smoke, Milk Chocolate, Butterscotch

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label LondonCities Series
characters: Smoke, Dark Chocolate, Honey, Tobacco, Rose, Hazelnut

name: Isle of Skye 30 Year Old Blended Whisky
characters: Pastries, Cherry, Almond, Coconut, Cinnamon, Peat smoke
reviews: I'm not ashamed in the slightest (okay maybe a little, I do call this my 'taterbait' whisky) to say that I bought this whisky for the box. The box is really something else, an impressive wooden construction that looks fantastic on my shelf. Thankfully, there is a surprisingly decent whisky with a rather complex nose and finish. It has a super silky mouthfeel that ultimately makes this very easy to drink. Considering there almost certainly 30-year old Talisker in here, it is rather hidden. The palate comes across grain heavy with more similarities to bourbon than not. While you certainly could do better from a value standpoint, this probably would make a killer gift for someone - especially given the presentation.
flavour_note: Pastries, Cherry, Almond, Coconut, Cinnamon, Peat smoke

name: Vat 69
reviews: For the price this is an excellent whisky. Very smooth and easy to drink, would buy again. || I was lucky enough to have an uncle who worked as a brewer at the south Queensferry distillery back in the 60's and this dumpy bottle was a gift to my father every Christmas he would put it in a flask for golfing with his work mates at the local golf course, it was Magic a real warmer after and during 18 holes, i must say it was a great feel for me also going to school my breath had still the taste in my mouth well worth £200 pounds these days || Wanted to try this due to rewatching Band of Brothers. reviews: A great new release. This is a rare blended whisky that is superior to many single malts. I say it is better than 3/4 of single malts in £35 to £65 price range. (And far superior to nearly all famous blended brands' premium bottles in £100 - £500 range.) If you are a peaty whisky lover (Islay style, Ledaig, Talisker, Connemara, peaty versions of Brora, etc), then stick to the normal Black Bottle, unless you also enjoy zesty (orange peel to be more precise) sweet tropical fruit style.
flavour_note: Pineapple, Coconut, Malt, Papaya, Caramel, Black Pepper

name: Teacher's Highland CreamBot.1980s
reviews: Awesome

name: Black Bottle
nose: Fresh and floral with freshly sawn oak aromas. Spicy with hints of smoke.
palate: Silky, mellow and fruity with balanced smoky / peaty flavours then sweet oak and heather honey.
finish: Soft, elegantly spicy, nutmeg, pepper and a gentle lingering smokiness.
reviews: Nose: Very pleasant nose for me, Oaky, mildly spiced fruit, caramel, floral. Taste: Woody spices, quite thin in viscosity, watery even, mellow. Once swallowed, the next taste, is hard to distinguish, as the finish covers the flavours in the mouth, tastes like it's been watered down, as it's so thin and smooth, it’s the sort of whisky that you could drink alot of and get very drunk, quite quickly as it's so mild. Finish: Not a strong finish, not aggressive like some other Whisky's, it's milder and more refined, a good whisky for evening drinking, it already tastes like it's been diluted with water or ice. Hints of Pepper and a gentle lingering smokiness, perfect for the table, prehaps with cheese to clean your palette before the next course, would I buy again, yes to share amongst dinner guests who are unsure about Whisky's. Perfect with a strong cheese. || Fantastic whisky gentle flavours. Am not a whisky drinker but really love this one || Great for the price. Sometimes you just want a shot of something and not think about it too much. However, that doesn’t mean you should compromise on the flavour. Black Bottle or Double Black by JW and you’ll be grand. || Not impressed || Always buy my Black Bottle from TWE. When I discovered this whisky I found what is now my firm favourite. I’ve heard people say it doesn’t compare well to the original. Well, I never tasted the original so am unable to compare, I love this whisky, a really strong flavour and bite with a m smooth hint of smokiness and a nice (but not too much) sweet rich finish. If you like rich but not overly smokey whisky give this one a go, I’m glad I did!!
flavour_note: Smoke, Oak, Heather, Honey, Apple Fresh and floral with freshly sawn oak aromas. Spicy with hints of smoke. Silky, mellow and fruity with balanced smoky / peaty flavours then sweet oak and heather honey. Soft, elegantly spicy, nutmeg, pepper and a gentle lingering smokiness.

name: Peter Dawson SpecialBot.1980s
reviews: This is an extremely beautiful whiskey. I cannot recommend it enough. I have sat here and thoroughly enjoyed this. So,So, smooth! I love Jamesons for its smoothness, but this for sure may be my new favourite. || Used to drink Peter Dawson Scotch whenever I could find it! Was similar in taste to Chivas! || Possibly (?) best known as the Scotch most drunk by Simon Templar in "The Saint" books (which is why I bought one). Very drinkable, but not off in any modest direction towards distinctive (although many expensive Scotches go too far that way IMHO, 15yo Laphroaig is as far as I go towards "distinctive" and still be happy)... I'll probably buy another bottle though, to go with the white jacket and hatred of people who screw other people over... although I seem to be lacking in femme fatales just at the present!!??!! 4* rating based on ST connection, 3* otherwise, 2* if you like really distinctive scotches. Oh and many thanks to The Whiskey Exchange for having this... || Peter Dawson Scotch was sold in Newfoundland back in the Eighties. It only came in 375 ml flasks. It reminded me a lot of Black And White. Very little peat. Softer than Bell's.

name: Pure Scot Signature 106
characters: Oak, Vanilla, Apple, Orange, Ginger, Toffee
reviews: Absolutely delicious, by far my favourite whisky so far and I have tried a few. I am a firm fan of the more gentle whiskies, Dalwhinnie instantly springs to mind. But this is instantly smoother which is really dangerous because at 53% ABV it really packs a punch. Flavours of hot buttered toast and Oxford marmalade instantly spring to the fore followed by a light fermented hay flavour and finishes sweet with a honey taste. A blended whisky that can beat many a pure malt into submission? Bladnoch are doing something right!
flavour_note: Oak, Vanilla, Apple, Orange, Ginger, Toffee

name: Woven Whisky Experience N.2
characters: White Pepper, Dried Fruit, Lemon, Orange
reviews: Was very excited to try this (and ordered concurrently with Woven #5 - I was that keen to try them). Maybe my expectations were unreasonably high but neither I nor my drinking partner liked either of the two I bought. Fundamentally they just taste like very young whisky; and I thought #2 in particular was very "fresh", and not in a good way unfortunately! I agree with the Woven that blended whisky is very underrated these days due to the single-malt mafia; however, neither of the two products I ordered are going to do blended whisky any favours in my opinion in this regard. I guess they are definitely an "experience", but if you want a nice tasting blended whisky for your nightcap or night out then look elsewhere.
flavour_note: White Pepper, Dried Fruit, Lemon, Orange

I love this whisky for its story. 45 years ago I bought a bottle in Rodel on the Isle of Lewis I was told it was the only place in the world you could buy this whisky as it was only made for the Queens households. This may have changed I have my bottle to my father in law who was a brigadier in the Indian Army and an avid whisky collector

name: Dewar's 15 Year OldClock Tin
reviews:
I bought a bottle of this today, mainly because I could not find JW Green, which I sampled last week and enjoyed very much. I tend to like Dewar's' house style; soft and sweet but unafraid to allow the grain to show itself. This expression is...uncomplicated. I've seen reviews claiming to taste all sorts of things in this whisky and I think it is fanciful nonsense. No, there isn't "roasted bananas with a hint of French lilac blossom."
I am a tiny bit disappointed due to one aspect of this dram; the finish is far too short. 
All in all, I think Dewar's should have done a bit better. 
3.5 stars.

nose: Green wine gums, key lime pie, lime leaves, gooseberries, vanilla wafers, new paper.
palate: Fresh cream, green cardamom pods, pine nuts, a few drops of absinthe, golden syrup, cashew butter, sponge cake. Wonderfully creamy without being too heavy.
finish: Long and silky with vanilla ice cream, coconut milk and a hint of freshly sawn oak.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Cream, Oak, Caraway, Lime, Coconut Green wine gums, key lime pie, lime leaves, gooseberries, vanilla wafers, new paper. Fresh cream, green cardamom pods, pine nuts, a few drops of absinthe, golden syrup, cashew butter, sponge cake. Wonderfully creamy without being too heavy. Long and silky with vanilla ice cream, coconut milk and a hint of freshly sawn oak.

name: Haig Club Clubman
reviews: I wish I bought cola with it. I tried to sip it in the evening but didn't manage. Should cost about 12 £ || Bought this as a change and to try something different. Wish i hadn't bothered as tastes awful, quite abrasive and I have since found out that it's more for mixing with mixers such as coke! Yuk Won't be buying again as it is z complete waste of money || Yes , I have tried it and having been a scotch drinker for years, found it a wonderful taste, || A Good whisky but still a good way of a malt whisky || appalling, disgusting liquid. All the money must have gone on branding and celeb endorsements because it certainly didn’t get spent on whats in the bottle, which is a truly foul concoction
flavour_note: Vanilla, Coconut, Custard

name: Port Dundas 200020 Year Old Single Cask Nation
Girvan 200219 Year Old Old Particular
characters: Honey, Hazelnut, Vanilla, White Pepper, Malt
flavour_note: Honey, Hazelnut, Vanilla, White Pepper, Malt

name: Port Dundas 200418 Year Old Old Particular
characters: Honey, Peach, Vanilla, Toffee, Ginger, Banana
flavour_note: Honey, Peach, Vanilla, Toffee, Ginger, Banana

name: Strathcolm Extra Special
nose: Toffee sweetness with orange blossom floral notes and a rich vein of vanilla.
palate: Attractively sweet and floral alongside nutty and fruity flavours.
finish: Endearingly smooth and creamy drawing out to a light vanilla close.
reviews: Not a fan. Too harsh. Alcohol overpowers the flavour. A "no" from me. || I have to say for the pricepoint, it is hard to beat. I have had the Hamiltons, Grangestone, Gleness and a few others that are at the top of my list. This is one of them. Very good profile. It has a nice mini warmth at the end as if to say thank you for trying me.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Toffee, Apricot, Cinnamon Toffee sweetness with orange blossom floral notes and a rich vein of vanilla. Attractively sweet and floral alongside nutty and fruity flavours. Endearingly smooth and creamy drawing out to a light vanilla close.

name: Strathclyde 200612 Year Old Distillery Reserve Collection
Caledonian 'The Cally' 197440 Year Old Special Releases
nose: Freshly varnished wood, model glue and polish – classic old grain whisky character. Behind those lighter notes sits a mature dram: salted caramel and vanilla toffee spiced up with freshly cracked black pepper.
palate: Rich and thick toffee, more sea salt, and baked apples studded with raisins. As it develops in the glass, concentrated fruity flavours start to come to the front – orange squash (with real fruit) and unsweetened blackcurrant juice.
finish: Lots of spice – liquorice root and cinnamon – fading through nutmeg to a gently tannic and pleasantly sour end.
reviews: Fantastic. Very smooth with great levels. Definitely a sipping Whisky. No water or ice for this one. || Outstanding single grain!
flavour_note: Honey, Toffee, Toast, Pineapple, Lime Freshly varnished wood, model glue and polish – classic old grain whisky character. Behind those lighter notes sits a mature dram: salted caramel and vanilla toffee spiced up with freshly cracked black pepper. Rich and thick toffee, more sea salt, and baked apples studded with raisins. As it develops in the glass, concentrated fruity flavours start to come to the front – orange squash (with real fruit) and unsweetened blackcurrant juice. Lots of spice – liquorice root and cinnamon – fading through nutmeg to a gently tannic and pleasantly sour end.

name: North British 199133 Year Old Oloroso Cask 262087 Signatory
characters: Malt, Honey, Liquorice root, Lemon, Stewed Fruit, Pecan
flavour_note: Malt, Honey, Liquorice root, Lemon, Stewed Fruit, Pecan

name: Caledonian 197634 Year Old Dead Whisky Society
Girvan 199727 Year Old Sovereign
characters: Custard, Vanilla, Caramel, Pastries, Tonka bean, Toffee
flavour_note: Custard, Vanilla, Caramel, Pastries, Tonka bean, Toffee

name: Port Dundas 200814 Year Old Sherry Casks 585869+74 Signatory
Cameronbridge 198435 Year Old The Artful Dodger
flavour_note: Milk Chocolate, Honeycomb, Malt, Vanilla

name: Caledonian 1987 Rare Auld34 Year Old Duncan Taylor
flavour_note: Vanilla, Peach, Honey, Toffee

name: Loch Lomond Distiller's Choice GrainCoffey Still
characters: Barley, Honey, Violet, Pear, Fudge, Vanilla
reviews: Light bodied. Sweet. Perfume-y on both the nose and palate. Not spirity. I suggest trying the standard Single Grain (Red & Black tube) if interested in the style, it’s better value (this one is pricey for what it is.)
flavour_note: Barley, Honey, Violet, Pear, Fudge, Vanilla

name: Blanton's Gold Edition
characters: Honey, Vanilla, Milk Chocolate, Apple, Butter, Dried Fruit
reviews: Best of all the Blantons! Delicious || A very nice sipping whisky, I am enjoying it immensely. || Very good value || Excellent bottle, never disappoints
flavour_note: Honey, Vanilla, Milk Chocolate, Apple, Butter, Dried Fruit

name: New Riff Bottled In Bond Kentucky Straight Bourbon
characters: Butterscotch, Oak, Vanilla, Rosemary, Cinnamon, White Pepper
reviews: I’m not much of a bourbon drinker but even I can tell this is a high quality drink that is equally drinkable on its own or in an old-fashioned. Smooth and flavoursome. || Really good and very smooth
flavour_note: Butterscotch, Oak, Vanilla, Rosemary, Cinnamon, White Pepper

name: Blanton's Original
reviews: Last year, I walked from Ohio over the bridge that straddles the Ohio River into Kentucky just to get a bourbon and Blanton's did not disappoint. I now had the opportunity to relive that experience by buying a bottle of here and wow, I was back there again......just the best bourbon I've ever tasted. || The most wonderful bourbon. So smooth. Wonderful taste. First bought for me in America. Not easy to get. Now I’m buying it for myself over here and it’s not cheap but worth every penny. Just bought another one as a special gift for a friend. || Ignoring the connections to John Wick, this is Bourbon Whiskey is the best I have ever tasted. Mine was dumped on20/03/23 from barrel No 264. Individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand at 93 proof. End result is a bourbon with extra flavour, and an incredible bouquet. It is so smooth then warming and a wonderful after taste. This is the best, well it has to be if John Wick drinks it ;-) || It's the best bourbon I have ever drunk. And it's the best from Blanton family which suits my taste. Really worth it gor a special occasion. || So its Blanton's, 'John Wick Monies', and you will need a Gold Coin to buy one lol :D but you're probably asking me right now, just tell me is it worth the hype, well no and yes (sigh), its a citrus bomb bourbon and complex just as much in its aromas as it is in taste, you really need to have an open mind and like more fruit/spice forward flavours if you want to enjoy this sipper, the vanilla and caramel is there but if you want a simple find that just resembles those of toffee and sugar notes i would go with Makers Mark 46 or better yet Woodford Reserve Double Oak, sometimes simple is better, but hey its also about mood too, you know what im talking about here ;) i payed £80 for this, i wouldn't pay anymore than that, is it worth it? yes i think so for its complexity! Enjoy your Bourbon ?
flavour_note: Caramel, Nutmeg, Raisins, Toffee, Oak

name: Jack Daniel's Legacy Edition Sour MashEdition 1
reviews:
This is one of my favourite Jack Daniel’s. For price point , probably my number 1.
I hope it will continue to be stocked for a little longer so I can get more ?? || One of the first bottles i ordered from TWE for my first time, Great bottle of Jack Daniels with a very slightly different but enjoyable taste and smell to the whiskey, can see myself buying this again! || It was a birthday present for a good friend, I know he will enjoy it. || Yes, I have tried this product. Excellent value. Smooth. Noticeably better than Old # 7.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Caramel, Toast, Oak

name: Angel's Envy BourbonPort Finish
characters: Vanilla, Dried Fruit, Toast, Dark Chocolate, Raisins
reviews: I bought this for my middle aged son. I know what he likes and I was sure he’d like this. The styling of the bottle sells it before you drink. The flavours are complex and finish in a lovely warmth. I’m looking forward to trying it as my son is really enjoying it. || One of my favorites! || A bourbon for scotch fans. So well rounded and just plain delicious. Not often you see an American whiskey finished in Port! || One of the best bourbons I’ve tasted. Wonderful smooth, round and sweet finish. || Lovely
flavour_note: Vanilla, Dried Fruit, Toast, Dark Chocolate, Raisins

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Old
characters: Almond, Cacao, Toffee, Leather, Oak, Honey
reviews: This is an excellent bourbon from Buffalo Trace. I term it a ‘dangerous sipper.’ Friends appreciate when this one is shared! || I ordered it for my birthday and I can say it got the party started will be getting it again || Immaculate, I had a friend recommend this bourbon stating it was his favorite and I was hesitant because we both have very different preferences with food and drink. Incredibly smooth and now one of my all time favorites. || Really rather good. Rich and subtle. Picked when my regular brand wasn't available. I'll certainly be adding it to the rota.
flavour_note: Almond, Cacao, Toffee, Leather, Oak, Honey

name: Elijah Craig Small Batch
characters: Caramel, Fruit Cake, Honey, Marmalade, Stewed Fruit
nose: Delightfully complex with notes of vanilla bean, sweet fruit, and fresh mint.
palate: Smooth and warm; pleasantly woody with accents of spice, smoke, and nutmeg
reviews: I love the flavour, with those notes of nuts, caramel and vanilla. || This truly is delicious. I am a huge fan of peated whisky. Smokehead high voltage being my favourite. I can't drink JD. It's just too sweet, but this as a bourbon isn't so sweet. It's a rich dark sweetness something similar to what you would find with Pussers gunpowder proof rum, only more refined. Very smooth. || This is in my sweet spot of proof (between 90-100) for a daily sipper. It has some lovely sweetness without being cloying. There's some oak, spice and vanilla all rolled into one. A good mid-range bourbon that has a lot of those traditional bourbon notes. || Sweet nuts and fruits with pleasant taste. Value for money. Its price in Thessaloniki is 37 euros. || I normally like my whiskey without an e. I got a bottle of this as mainly to make some cocktails. Obviously I have sampled neat it for QC purposes. It’s quite sweet, lots of caramel, rich and almost unctuous reminds me of an xo zacapa rum. The wood, nuts and leather comes out over ice or with water. Works well in a Dry Manhattan or old fashioned.
flavour_note: Caramel, Fruit Cake, Honey, Marmalade, Stewed Fruit Delightfully complex with notes of vanilla bean, sweet fruit, and fresh mint. Smooth and warm; pleasantly woody with accents of spice, smoke, and nutmeg Long, sweet, and slightly toasty

name: Rittenhouse Bottled In Bond Straight Rye100 Proof
characters: Orange, White Pepper, Honey, Oak, Cinnamon, Tobacco
reviews: Wonderful drink. Really like the spice and warmth. || Strong Full bodied Rye ( this is my first Rye). Not a smooth as Irish Whiskey but it has it's own charm. It will lend itself to mixers because of its dominant flavours. || Purchased for my husband for use in his authentic Manhattan cocktails. He says it is very very good. || STILL DELICIOUS. Reviews below back to 2011 rave and it is still fantastic and affordable. Let it sit for 15 minutes and add a few drops of water. Crazy good. Every sip is a little different. Carmel, rye bread, spice, tobacco, leather and grandpa's old pipe. I think I like this more than my favorite bourbon.
flavour_note: Orange, White Pepper, Honey, Oak, Cinnamon, Tobacco

name: Michter's US*1 Small Batch Bourbon
characters: Dried Fruit, Cinnamon, Oak, Vanilla, Toffee
nose: Appealingly rich notes of barley sugar, raisins and dried fruit, with a balancing touch of fennel seed and baked bread.
palate: Rich and spicy, with juicy fruit, cinnamon and clean, well-defined flavours.
finish: Welcoming kick of black pepper, then the dried fruit stays strong.
reviews: Wonderful rich fragrance and flavour, with those elements of cinnamon and vanilla. I enjoyed it very much. || A rich and beautifully balanced bourbon. Some cinnamon spice but also a vanilla smoothness at times. No harshness or "burn" and thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish. || Its fantastic. Plain and simple! || Yet another fine offering from Michters. Carmel and vanilla up front with solid oak on the finish. It is well above the competiton in my opinion. || Excellent bourbon, better value than Blanton’s and just as enjoyable.
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Cinnamon, Oak, Vanilla, Toffee Appealingly rich notes of barley sugar, raisins and dried fruit, with a balancing touch of fennel seed and baked bread. Rich and spicy, with juicy fruit, cinnamon and clean, well-defined flavours. Welcoming kick of black pepper, then the dried fruit stays strong.

name: Four Roses Single Barrel Bourbon
nose: Fruity, spicy, floral, caramel, vanilla, cocoa, maple syrup, moderately woody.
palate: Hints of ripe plum & cherries, robust, full body, mellow.
reviews: Fantastic bourbon! Bold and intense with fruit and a little bite. Provides a full pallet of flavors. Worth every penny! || I've wanted to try it for sometime, bought a bottle and it exceeded all expectations and now will be a regular bottle amongst the others. || After ayear or so trying out various scotch whiskys I have to admit that this is a refreshing change of direction. Bold, prominent and unique. Very enjoyable. || Tried this one at the Whisky Show. Best bourbon I've ever had. Slight oiliness to the texture and a nice spicy taste. Liquid silk in a bottle, loved it. Would highly recommend. || This is absolutely sensational. Small batch is also incredibly good but single barrel is an absolute gem. Bursting with rich character and super smooth despite it’s proof.
flavour_note: Oak, Plums, Caramel, Prunes, Vanilla Fruity, spicy, floral, caramel, vanilla, cocoa, maple syrup, moderately woody. Hints of ripe plum & cherries, robust, full body, mellow. Smooth & delicately long.

name: Four Roses Small Batch Bourbon
nose: Spicy, rich, mellow, fruity, hints of sweet oak and caramel.
palate: Creamy, mellow, ripened red berries, rich, spicy, well-balanced, moderately sweet.
reviews: beautiful whisky || Best at under 30 USDs in Indiana USA || Really good bourbon || Nice bourbon, has more of a sweetness to it in the bourbon flavour profile. I'm assuming its a lower Rye mix as its not spicy. Really easy drinking I'm not sure its worth the 10 quid extra compared to a buillet or even buffalo trace. || Am I in any way shape or form an expert = no. Do I in all shapes and forms like a good tasting drink = yes. This is a bourbon which benefits from time left in the glass. At sipping it soon after pouring out of the glass, it was harsh and sweet. However, on returning some 8-10mins later the taste was very smooth, sweet and spicy. All thoughts of having to find a chaser for it simply slipped away. A lovely bourbon at a lovely price to make it a regular on my list of favourites - pour, rest, drink and enjoy!
flavour_note: Strawberry, Caramel, Vanilla, Cinnamon Spicy, rich, mellow, fruity, hints of sweet oak and caramel. Creamy, mellow, ripened red berries, rich, spicy, well-balanced, moderately sweet. Soft, smooth and pleasantly long.

name: Old Grand Dad 80 Proof
characters: Tobacco, Nutmeg, White Pepper, Cherry, Butterscotch, Caramel
reviews: Its my all time favourite bourbon ?? drunk it for years then couldn't get it ,nice to see it again also ,for the first time 114 old Grandad bourbon.
flavour_note: Tobacco, Nutmeg, White Pepper, Cherry, Butterscotch, Caramel

name: Woodford Reserve Distiller's Select
characters: Cinnamon, Brioche, Honey, Mint, Apricot, Sultana
nose: Heavy with rich dried fruit, hints of mint and oranges covered with a dusting of cocoa. Faint vanilla and tobacco spice.
palate: Great balance between sweet fruit, toasty oak and warm spices. Juicy sultanas, cinnamon-dusted pastries and Demerara sugar, freshened up with mint and caraway seed. Deliciously soft mouthfeel.
finish: Silky smooth, almost creamy at first with a long, warm satisfying tail.
reviews:
This is the second time that I drank Woodford Reserve (1.0L). I read all these reviews and that is why I gave it a second shot. Yes, it has a lot of taste, but as with any bourbon, contrary to good single malt whiskies, it always burns my mouth and tongue. Too much. Too too much. This burning sensation destroys every good element. No more bourbons for me || First bourbon trial for me. Had sifferent whiskies and cognacs. This feels like something between a whisky and a cognac (perhaps due to some sweetness but its nicely controlled). Love it. Good value for the money and I rather have this than any vsop cognac. After couple of sips your mouth is full of flavours that stay for long. Brilliant. || There is only one cocktail for me, the Whiskey Old Fashioned.
There is only one bourbon for it, Woodford Reserve. 
I’ve tried them all, Wild Turkey, Beam, Bulleitt, Four Roses, Tin Cup, you name it. 
And although there’s some 8/10, some 9/10, there’s only one 10/10! Woodford. || It's a good balance & affordable  Kentucky Straight Whiskey. || The spiciness surprised me, but it has a very full, very good flavor. Excellent value at its price point.
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Brioche, Honey, Mint, Apricot, Sultana Heavy with rich dried fruit, hints of mint and oranges covered with a dusting of cocoa. Faint vanilla and tobacco spice. Great balance between sweet fruit, toasty oak and warm spices. Juicy sultanas, cinnamon-dusted pastries and Demerara sugar, freshened up with mint and caraway seed. Deliciously soft mouthfeel. Silky smooth, almost creamy at first with a long, warm satisfying tail.

name: Wild Turkey Longbranch
characters: Butter, Vanilla, Lemon, Caramel, Toffee, Nutmeg
reviews: Nice rich oaky taste - nice to have something different || Honestly didn’t love it, a bit rough around the edges and was missing personality. It goes well with coke though. I would go with bulleit bourbon or buffalo trace as they are in the same price category and are much more smooth, tasty and enjoyable… || Balanced, smooth with a soft gobble-gobble in the background. Fantastic value. || A sweet and really accessible bourbon. Goes fantastic over ice or with a coke. I love wild turkey and my go to is always a buffalo trace. This one, is a worthy alternative for a change from my usual and my wife also enjoys it as she can drink it with a coke or neat. For me, this is testament to the balance it brings. It has my vote. || I've always been a fan of the Wild Turkey Bourbon flavor profile. This falls in with that but has more complexity, fuller flavor and a stronger finish. Currently my favorite bourbon at any price.
flavour_note: Butter, Vanilla, Lemon, Caramel, Toffee, Nutmeg

name: Booker's BourbonBatch 2024-01E
characters: Coconut, Caramel, Milk Chocolate, White Pepper, Cinnamon
flavour_note: Coconut, Caramel, Milk Chocolate, White Pepper, Cinnamon

name: E. H. Taylor Small Batch
characters: Vanilla, Cinnamon, Oak, Caramel, Stewed Fruit
reviews: This an exceptional Bourbon. My new favourite!! Just ordering my second bottle. Suggest you get one quick. || the hype made it bit expensive, but it is a great bourbon. || E.H never let me down || By far one of the best US whiskeys I have ever had. Full flavor with an amazing finish. || Best bourbon I ever put in my mouth... The caramel notes are unbelievable
flavour_note: Vanilla, Cinnamon, Oak, Caramel, Stewed Fruit

name: Blanton's Straight From The Barrel(62.8%)
characters: Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Caramel, Vanilla
reviews: This is great!!!  Hot with a lot of flavor!!
flavour_note: Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Caramel, Vanilla

name: Uncle Nearest 1856 Whiskey
characters: Caramel, Vanilla, Dried Fruit, Raisins, Biscuits, Hay
reviews: This is a belter of a whiskey. Absolutely love it. Even got my mates who are ardent malt whisky drinkers to admit it’s a cracker.
flavour_note: Caramel, Vanilla, Dried Fruit, Raisins, Biscuits, Hay

name: FEW Bourbon
reviews: The most quintessential example of a highly-charred-barrel bourbon. Best in class (of highly-charred-barrel bourbons). || full on caramel rich and deep, had it after a steak meal straight from the bottle (no ice) sipped very slowly... superb || Seriously the most flavoursome bourbon I’ve ever tasted. Just delicious || Got this from my gf last christmas and i really like it! Unusual taste for a bourbon but i was really into the peppermint touch. Getting more of this one. || The label on the back says "it is a bourbon of uncommen complexity". That is definitely correct. There are many flavours throughout the taste and they are all enjoyable and none overpowering. It's a very interesting mixture of caramel, smoke, peppermint, almost like a single malt sometimes. Very glad I took a gamble on this, its definitely one for the collection shelf. But it's very moreish so I'll have to buy some more..
flavour_note: Toffee, Clove, Vanilla, Apple, Ginger

name: Sazerac Rye
characters: White Pepper, Vanilla, Ginger, Marmalade, Orange
reviews: A smooth whisky with notes of vanilla and honey. Very easy to drink - but enjoy it slowly. || A spicy rye whiskey which is not only good for making sazerac cocktails, but is well worth drinking straight.
flavour_note: White Pepper, Vanilla, Ginger, Marmalade, Orange

name: Maker's Mark 46 Bourbon
reviews: Fantastic product || for me, very smooth either on its own without ice or with ice in an old fashioned || Just having a drink now, this is a top class bourbon the nose is sumptuous the taste lingers well, i have no hesitation giving 5 stars || An excellent bourbon. Better than many others out there. || I have tried makers 46 and it knocks the socks off of any jack D you can get
flavour_note: Oak, Caramel, Vanilla, Dried Fruit

name: Woodford Reserve Double Oaked
nose: Rich notes of dark fruit, caramel, sharp honey, chocolate, marzipan and toasted oak.
palate: A full-bodied mix of vanilla, dark caramel, hazelnut, apple, fruit and spices.
finish: Long and creamy with lingering hints of honeyed apple.
reviews: Pleasant on the nose, getting werthers original, fruit pastels (the green ones), oat milk and a touch of fresh cut grass. This is a good addition to my collection and sitting proudly between my Ribena and root beer. || An excellent flavourfull bourbon for those who would love a strong oaky taste. I am a scotch guy but whenever I wanna go to bourbon this one is my first choice along with Wild Turkey Rare breed. || Such an incredible bourbon. Rich and smooth and with a great aroma. The addition of the charring really sets it apart. One to enjoy neat. || My all-time favorite bourbon (all-time being 3 years of bourbon drinking for me). I always keep an open bottle and a backup in reserve, but I stick to store picks. Maybe it's just psychological that they taste better, because they're obviously not single-barrel versions, given the fact that double-oaked is finished in a second barrel. || This is such a nice bourbon. I was a bit sceptical about it before purchasing but decided to bite the bullet and try it and honestly it’s earned a permanent place on my shelf.
flavour_note: Toffee, Caramel, Oak, Tobacco, Clove Rich notes of dark fruit, caramel, sharp honey, chocolate, marzipan and toasted oak. A full-bodied mix of vanilla, dark caramel, hazelnut, apple, fruit and spices. Long and creamy with lingering hints of honeyed apple.

name: Willett's Pot Still Reserve Single Barrel Bourbon
reviews: Great bottle. For me a very classy whisky taste not a sensuous bourbon taste. || Love this smooth, flavorful bourbon.  Just the right amount of oak and a nice finish. || Very smooth.  Neat is the way to go with this very fine bourbon. || This is a good high end.  To my taste, not a great one.  A bit on the harsh side but rich flavor.

name: Jack Daniel's Bonded100 Proof Bottled-in-Bond
reviews: The usual lovely nose of bourbon, banana and wood with a strong kick letting you know the proof is that bit higher. Has a great kick and is best drank with ice, I wouldn't go slapping in coke like normal Jack this is best enjoyed neat with ice. || Excellent taste and super smooth || Unexpected. Perfect for those days of rain or snow. In my personal view (and taste) is better than Glenfarclas 105.
flavour_note: Caramel, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Smoke, Oak

name: Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel Bourbon
reviews: Absolutely one of the top top bottles you will find…outstanding || It's all in the hooves || A decent enough bourbon, particularly when considering the price, with good structure and balance.... But I found the wood much too green for my taste. || Excellent bourbon, very smooth. || Amazing bourbon,smooth with so many flavours ,will get another couple of bottles

name: Jack Daniel's Gentleman Jack
nose: Lighter oak and drier on the nose than Old No.7. Vanilla, brown sugar, maple and apple.
palate: Sweet vanilla, stone fruits and apple.
finish: Subtle oak that develops into a smooth finish of fruit with maple and floral honey.
reviews: At Lynchburg distillery they do the right thing to draw customers who enjoyed JD No.7. In Gentleman Jack the smoothness level is turned up a notch compared to No.7. due to double charcoal mellowing. Is it for the better or for worse? Many people enjoy the extra smoothness which comes with even less impurities. On the other hand, this removes some of the smell and taste qualities given by the production process. There will be many whiskey lovers who will not be ready to fork out extra cash for less taste. I'm in this group. To each their own. || I don't like regular JD but this is very smooth with a sweet palette, honey and marzipan flavours and a citrus finish. Very good. || Gentleman Jack. Not surprising why Jack Daniels are about the most well known whiskey. Nothing harsh very easy to drink. Does not need to be mixed with anything, you can go without ice. It is very good liquid gold. (Y) || Excellent quality gift engraved for our friends anniversary. Will be buying again! ?? || Bought it as a gift. Had bottle engraved. Wonderful presentation. Receiver was over the moon with the gift
flavour_note: Vanilla, Apple, Honey, Dried Fruit Lighter oak and drier on the nose than Old No.7. Vanilla, brown sugar, maple and apple. Sweet vanilla, stone fruits and apple. Subtle oak that develops into a smooth finish of fruit with maple and floral honey.

name: Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye
nose: Very aromatic and fresh. Almost minty, with lovely savoury edge, then measured spiciness comes through.
palate: Incredibly smooth mouthfeel for a rye, this is clean and balanced, then the caraway and fennel seed kicks in.
reviews: Excellent stuff – smooth as silk. || Fantastic.  Smooth with depth of flavour.  Similar to their American unblended with a more grassy finish.  Very nice. || One of the smoothest and best tasting ryes I have had the pleasure of drinking. || Excellent stuff. I thought we in Canada did rye whisky better than anyone, until I tried this. Outstanding. Smooth, rich, sweet, with just enough spice. || The best single barrel Bourbon made in America.
flavour_note: Black Pepper, Orange, Butterscotch, Oak Very aromatic and fresh. Almost minty, with lovely savoury edge, then measured spiciness comes through. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel for a rye, this is clean and balanced, then the caraway and fennel seed kicks in. Appealingly dry spiciness – impressive stuff.

name: Mellow Corn
reviews: The presentation made me smile and the contents were delicious. || Perfect for the Irish coffee ! || I’d be lying if I said it was full of character and heaps of flavours but, I’d take this over a good many blends and as the name suggests, it’s mellow despite slightly higher proof || Picked this up on a whim to see if I liked corn whiskey. Turns out I do. Banana and toasted sugar on the nose, big, sweet grain on the finish. Appreciable simplicity. A splash of water will tone it right down if the 100 proof isn't to your liking. Didn't have high hopes based on the price point (acquired in the states), but I was presently surprised. Would recommend if you are looking for something basic and drinkable. || Very good for cocktails, but I don't like it straight.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Caramel, Toast, Brioche

name: Frey Ranch Bottled in Bond Rye
reviews: One of the best ryes I've ever had. A carefully crafted old-fashioned with this will knock your boots off. || First ever bottle of rye….so happy I bought this. It’s fantastic. Rarely seen in the UK. So happy I’ve bought more, just incase exchange run out and never replace it. Oily texture, vanilla , slight smoke, rich candy, and leather. On the palate it’s, sweet, coffee, dark chocolate . Try getting other bottles from the Frey farm Whisky exchange….would appreciate it || Many thanks to the Whisky Exchange for adding the Frey Ranch rye to their stock. A grain to glass rye rather than another sourced Ross & Squibb 95/5 rye. A decent proof point being bottled in bond and enough age to not be young and grain forward like many craft distilleries. I would recommend as a product and will certainly repurchase to keep a bottle on the shelf.
flavour_note: Black Pepper, Ginger, Butter, Caramel

name: Woodford Reserve Rye Whiskey
characters: Black Pepper, Tobacco, Nutmeg, Honey, Mint, Apple
nose: Spicy with distinct notes of rye, black pepper, cedar and cassia bark sweetened with a dusting of marzipan. Hints of pear, apple and almond dance in its depths.
reviews: What an incredible introduction to rye whiskey. Phenomenal taken neat and also great in cocktails. I made exactly the Manhattan recipe shown here and it was extraordinary. || Black pepper, apple and honey. Value for money. Very good experience. || A really buttery taste and smooth. Lovely || It was bought as a gift, which appeared to be v.much appreciated! From the few sips I got of it, it's luuuurrrrvely. || Perfect for an old fashioned!
flavour_note: Black Pepper, Tobacco, Nutmeg, Honey, Mint, Apple Spicy with distinct notes of rye, black pepper, cedar and cassia bark sweetened with a dusting of marzipan. Hints of pear, apple and almond dance in its depths. Long and sweetly spiced.

name: Maker's Mark
nose: Initial sweetness – caramel, brown sugar – gives way to soft fruity notes and vanilla.
palate: More savoury than the nose suggests, with toasted nuts and cinnamon notes.
finish: Initially light but sweet spice builds over time.
reviews:
A perfect introduction to the world of bourbons. Easy sipping, maple syrup and vanilla notes, this is a must have in every home bar. || It a difficult one makers mark. It's a great bourbon if you give it some time in the glass like a good 10 minutes and like most bourbon room temperature or above. It can be very alcohol forward for a 45 percent bourbon if it's not left but there is a wonderful drink here with some really nice sweet bourbon flavours || Initial scent: mothers nail varnish remover, sweetness detected, however, overpowered by menthol on a winters day. Taste: evaporates off the tongue like half a hive of wasps. God forbid you have a cut on your lip. Lingering taste: oaky sunflowers and gasoline. Aftertaste: dry bread and prolonged acid reflux, gives an overwhelming sense of regret. 

 I can honestly say I would rather drink listerine then chug ice water in Antarctica. 

9/10 || This and Woodford Reserve are the two best reasonably-prices bourbons I've tasted. || My whiskey of choice at the moment.
A great drink to end the day.
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Almond, Vanilla Initial sweetness – caramel, brown sugar – gives way to soft fruity notes and vanilla. More savoury than the nose suggests, with toasted nuts and cinnamon notes. Initially light but sweet spice builds over time.

name: Yellowstone Rum Cask FinishSpecial Finishes Collection
characters: Marshmallow, Tobacco, Orange, Toffee, Cinnamon, White Pepper
flavour_note: Marshmallow, Tobacco, Orange, Toffee, Cinnamon, White Pepper

name: Jim Beam Single Barrel
reviews: I’ve recently bought two bottles of this & they’re both very different whiskeys the first bottle was very balanced quite dry & full of oak, & brown sugar on the nose, all the typical bourbon notes & quite smooth on the finish typically Jim Beam . The other bottle wow boom !!! On the nose sweet maple pancakes, then on the palate vanilla lots of it, maybe some apple strudel in there, yes apple strudel , it’s rougher on the finish , still very dry if not dryer than the first.. lots of rye some artificial sweetness in there but in quite a good way. I’m really enjoying this bottle as it’s nothing like a shelf bought bourbon. It’s very unique, it’s like a flavour bouncing ball around my palate maybe a little too much for some folks. I’m very reluctant to finish this bottle in case I can’t get another. The bottle label noted are below. First Bottle label JB1003 Second Bottle label JB002 || Beautiful! Jim beam is a very underated bourbon in my opinion
flavour_note: Caramel, Oak, Vanilla, Dried Fruit

name: Yellowstone Select
reviews: Nice and smooth, good on the nose. How a bourbon should taste. || Absolutely fabulous || Excellent pour. Has a spicy sweet and oaky flavor. Well worth the price of the bottle! || Really enjoyable bourbon. A definite hit of caramel, quite smooth and a long aftertaste makes it something worth going back to. || Lovely drink – everything you want from a bourbon
flavour_note: Cherry, Caramel, Oak

name: Jack Daniel's Bonded Rye100 Proof Bottled-in-Bond
flavour_note: Maple syrup, Black Pepper, Banana

name: Uncle Nearest 1884 Small Batch Whiskey
characters: Smoke, Butter, Biscuits, Vanilla, Toast, Honey
flavour_note: Smoke, Butter, Biscuits, Vanilla, Toast, Honey

name: Four Roses Bourbon
nose: Pear and light fruitiness, floral, gentle spice, honey.
palate: Crisp, yet soft and smooth, fresh fruit, hints of apple.
reviews: This bourbon is a birthday present for my stepson, but it it’s like the Four Roses I drank whilst stationed in Germany I know he will like it || It's as average as you can get with a bourbon. Not bad, but also not great either. Good for cocktails, but I would prefer something with a bit more complexity for sipping. || Barely drinkable, avoid! || Tried , enjoyed and re will be re buying ! || A real cowboy whiskey with lots of leather and tobacco in the nose and palate. Not to everyone's taste but I rather like it. Good in cocktails as well as perfectly drinkable neat or on the rocks.
flavour_note: Apple, Pear, Honey Pear and light fruitiness, floral, gentle spice, honey. Crisp, yet soft and smooth, fresh fruit, hints of apple. Soft and smooth.

name: Bulleit Bourbon Whiskey
nose: Rich and spicy, with warming notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove, and crème brûlée topped with Demerara sugar. Hints of dried apricot, grape and almond, too.
palate: Good spicy kick of rye first up, then softer notes of dried fruit and sweet spice follow. Toasty and nutty, with enough fruitiness to soften out the edges.
finish: Well-balanced mix of sweet spice and warming rye.
reviews: Nice bourbon, maybe a tone too sweet for my taste || Love this bourbon, it hits the spot perfectly and its spices leaves my tastebuds tingling. Far exceeds other brands in the price range. Great over ice and would never add a mixer More than I would usually pay for for a bourbon drunk on a regular basis, but well worth the cost. || Sweet smooth yet spicy is it is a perfect sipping sipping whiskey for any time || A high 8.2 out of 10 || This bourbon doesn't taste like regular bourbons,but has a hint & kick of "whiskey" taste to it. Very enjoyable,will definitely buy again!
flavour_note: Apricot, Almond, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Clove Rich and spicy, with warming notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove, and crème brûlée topped with Demerara sugar. Hints of dried apricot, grape and almond, too. Good spicy kick of rye first up, then softer notes of dried fruit and sweet spice follow. Toasty and nutty, with enough fruitiness to soften out the edges. Well-balanced mix of sweet spice and warming rye.

name: Jack Daniel's Old No.7Magnum
nose: Notes of caramel, vanilla and spice, smooth toasted oak
reviews: The best sipping whiskey on the planet || What can be said about old no. 7? As the most popular and enjoyed whiskey on planet earth, this drink is enjoyed everyday somewhere in the world. It's characteristics make it perfect for cocktails, shots, or enjoyment on its own. Weather you're at the bars looking for an exciting night or winding down with your friends after a long week, Jack's got your back. || The best
flavour_note: Vanilla, Lemon, Cinnamon, Toast Notes of caramel, vanilla and spice, smooth toasted oak

name: Leiper's Fork Bottled in Bond Bourbon
characters: Praline, Milk Chocolate, Oak, Cherry, Cinnamon, Mint
flavour_note: Praline, Milk Chocolate, Oak, Cherry, Cinnamon, Mint

name: Basil Hayden Bourbon
characters: Butter, Lemon, Brioche, Vanilla, Dark Chocolate, Cream
reviews: Nice on the initial sip, but has an odd peanut aftertaste. Wouldn’t get it again. || I enjoyed it. It is a nice drink to have with buddies out around a fire. My friends enjoy Scotch I myself enjoy Bourbon more. As we live in Canada we get a variety of different Bourbons from the US but Basil Hayden is one of the ones I grab when I go to Hunting camp. It has nice flavour and is a nice sipping Bourbon. || I am definitely not as keen on this as others seem to be, although saying that i am not a big bourbon drinker. Tastes like overpowered Southern Comfort to me || A great aroma and once a big chunk of ice is added to open it up, its silky smooth. Tried with ginger ale - sweet and smooth taste. || No2 on my all time list of Bourbons. A great aroma and once a big chunk of ice is added to open it up, its silky smooth. Nothing else at this £55 price point compares in my experience.
flavour_note: Butter, Lemon, Brioche, Vanilla, Dark Chocolate, Cream Dry, clean, brief

name: Wild Turkey 101
characters: Cinnamon, Clove, Nutmeg, Hazelnut, Mint, Toffee
nose: Big! Peppery, spicy, lots of rye and caraway seed, but still fresh, with some toffee sweetness in there, too.
palate: Beautiful concentration, with waves of spicy cinnamon, clove and nutmeg, toasted hazelnuts and a faint, fresh, minty note.
finish: The wide-ranging spiciness lasts for a very long time.
reviews: Love this. Have always been a fan of Maker's Mark, Buffalo Trace and Bulleit, probably in that order, but this is different. Hard-hitting, with a deep rich flavour that really lingers (in a good way). It reminds me of Lakes No 5, an atypical English Whisky - not easy drinking, but a nice challenge, to be savoured and remembered. || Without doubt one of the best bourbon for your cash. I've been trying lots of different bourbons over the years as we all do but this is just lovely. Its only bettered I believe by the Wild Turkey rare breed but thats a whole other animal or should I say bird. || Good corn bourbon for good price. || Lovely Rye bourbon..really nice..not too sweet,eell balanced and yummy. || Had this bought for me as a present, won’t drink anything else anymore
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Clove, Nutmeg, Hazelnut, Mint, Toffee Big! Peppery, spicy, lots of rye and caraway seed, but still fresh, with some toffee sweetness in there, too.
