Beautiful concentration, with waves of spicy cinnamon, clove and nutmeg, toasted hazelnuts and a faint, fresh, minty note. The wide-ranging spiciness lasts for a very long time.

name: WhistlePig PiggyBack 6 Year Old Rye
characters: Black Pepper, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Orange, Grapefruit, Leather
reviews: An excellent bourbon. Very smooth and well worth the price. Possibly my new favourite
flavour_note: Black Pepper, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Orange, Grapefruit, Leather

name: Noah's Mill Bourbon
reviews: Noah’s mill what a amazing bourbon would hard to fined a better one || One of my favourite bourbons ever. However watch out if it's tastes like mud that's an off batch. || Singularly the most wonderful bourbon I have tried. Please notify me of a bourbon more superior.

name: Bomberger's Declaration2024 Release
characters: Plums, Vanilla, Oak, Honey, Almond, Pecan
flavour_note: Plums, Vanilla, Oak, Honey, Almond, Pecan

name: Templeton Midnight Rye
characters: Rye, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Pineapple, Sage, Caramel
flavour_note: Rye, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Pineapple, Sage, Caramel

name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Old Barrel Proof(62.8%)
Bulleit '95' Rye
food_paring: Fried Chicken, Bbq Ribs, Roasted Aubergine
reviews: This is probably my favourite Rye, out of all the ryes I have tasted, very smooth, lots of flavours , I prefer it over Bulleit bourbon and Bulleit 10 yr, definitely recommend || I love the spicy fragrance, reflected in the flavour. Smooth and slightly sweet, a lovely whiskey. || A good 7.6 out of 10 || This is, for the money, the best rye out there in my opinion. While it doesn’t have the complexity of some of its more pricey rivals, it’s a beautifully smooth, sippable whiskey with enough spice to make it an absolute favourite || Simply the best rye
flavour_note: Vanilla, Honey, Grass, Peach

name: Wild Turkey Rare BreedBarrel Proof
characters: Dark Chocolate, Caramel, Clove, Oak, White Pepper
reviews: Fantastic not to be knocked back but savoured this is a great bourbon || Tastes like pure gasoline. Wonderful! || Yes i have tried it. It is my weekly buy. Like the higher proof they went to in 2008 i believe it was. I cannot taste the flavors like some people can but i can tell if its good or not. Now if Stagg was available on a consistent basis i might would change. || Yes it like paint stripper. || This is in my view, as good as it gets. This is my third bottle and it is seriously good. Will buy again
flavour_note: Dark Chocolate, Caramel, Clove, Oak, White Pepper

name: Ben Holladay Wheated Bourbon 2017 Rick House Proof
characters: Caramel, Vanilla, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Almond, Cherry
flavour_note: Caramel, Vanilla, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Almond, Cherry

name: Bardstown Bourbon Co Straight Bourbon
flavour_note: Vanilla, Oak, Mint, Nutmeg, Orange

name: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Old World Rye Whiskey
Jack Daniels Master Distiller No 5
reviews: Classic Jack Daniel’s, very smooth || Smooth. Of the master distiller series, 1 and 5 are by far the best offering. Agree with the hint of rye. Incredible value, I have it on a par with single barrel. Future classic, get and enjoy while you can. || so smooth, I love it || This is really excellent .. smooth and a little spicy, almost has me wondering if there's a hint of rye there.

name: New York Ragtime Rye Bottled in Bond
characters: White Pepper, Nutmeg, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Oak, Blackberry
reviews: Hard to believe this is only 4 y/o. The only point this whisky shows it's age is in a little bit of alcohol nip but other than that, it is a complex & delicious dram. Cinnamon, Clove, Nutmeg, Cola Cubes, Pepper, Vanilla, A little Cherry preserve on the finish, Virginia tobacco and the slightest of slight hints of pepper mint. If you enjoy Rye, this whisky is well worth considering.
flavour_note: White Pepper, Nutmeg, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Oak, Blackberry

name: Jim Beam Double Oak
characters: Oak, Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Clove, Toffee
reviews: Absolutely bang on || Not as smooth as some of the other Jim Beam offerings but has enough going on to warrant it's additional cost compared to JB White Label || fantastic top shelf bourbon, acetone & caramel sweetness, jim beam at its best, superb || I'm Born Scottish. l live in Edinburgh, and I'm a Single Malt Guy. I've had "Whiskey" before, & always found it tasty, & acceptable. Earlier today I was given a Bottle of this from my friend & Neighbour, and I have to say, it's very palatable. :-) Totally different from my usual Single Malt Scotch.. It's very smooth, I love the taste of Oak (Usually I drink quite "Sherried" Speysides. ) Is this an example of "Proper Sippin' Whiskey"?? Nice one Guys. || Incredibly smooth bourbon. It's great over ice.
flavour_note: Oak, Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Clove, Toffee

name: Koval Bourbon
reviews: I am scotch fan but this became my favourite dram recently. Millet in the mash bill certainly makes it very different from other bourbons I’ve tried. Quite unexpected from a kraft distillery. Will certainly buy it again and will try their other expressions. || Outstanding. The best I've tried so far. || Had high hopes for this whisky....Whilst in America was recommended as a great new Bourbon. Bought some as soon as got home and was disappointed think David Beckhams Haig but more expensive.

name: Elijah Craig Straight Rye Whiskey
characters: Honeycomb, Black Pepper, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon
flavour_note: Honeycomb, Black Pepper, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon

name: Bardstown Bourbon Co Origin Series High Wheat Bourbon
characters: Crème Brûlée, Leather, Cherry, Lemon, Apricot
flavour_note: Crème Brûlée, Leather, Cherry, Lemon, Apricot

name: Woodford Reserve Five-Malt Stouted MashMasters Collection
characters: Hazelnut, Milk Chocolate, Cherry, Shortbread, Lemon
flavour_note: Hazelnut, Milk Chocolate, Cherry, Shortbread, Lemon

name: Buffalo Trace Kosher Straight Rye
characters: Toffee, Maple syrup, White Pepper, Stewed Fruit, Cinnamon
flavour_note: Toffee, Maple syrup, White Pepper, Stewed Fruit, Cinnamon

name: Widow Jane 10 Year Old
characters: Vanilla, Cherry, Maple syrup, Almond, Oak
flavour_note: Vanilla, Cherry, Maple syrup, Almond, Oak

name: Buffalo Trace White Dog Mash 1Half Bottle
reviews: This exceeded my expectations by far. First of all, the opportunity to try distillate before it’s aged is such a great experience. It allows one to gauge what flavors are brought on by cask maturation. Second, and this was the surprise, it tastes great. Perfectly drinkable on it’s own, it’s rich and smooth. Five Stars for the opportunity and experience. If you like Bourbon, this is a must try. || I will agree this very unique to me it has sort of popcorn/yeast taste, i didn't have any burn at all but then again I regularly drink real bourbon, the kick wasn't bad either. All that said not something I would buy again not a traditional taste at all. || This product is outstanding !!! White Dog is "unique" very special and is so different to other whiskeys. It is very smooth and so strong the only negative thing I have to say is avout this product is that it could be very addictive as it is such an amazing product, if you like whiskey then you have not lived until you try white dog it truly is the best whiskey on planet earth !!! I also love the bottle as it looks very much like a prescription bottle that a doctor would give out to patients! || This is an expensive curiosity at best. It has an unpleasantly strong corn flavour, some good grain tastes in the finish, and is full of feints. It would be great to know if this is exactly Buffalo Trace Bourbon, but unaged, or a slightly modified recipe/expression. If it is the former, it is a good (but again, a rather expensive) illustration of the effects of aging and oaking on a spirit. If it is the latter, it is a cynical gimmick. || Brought this out to a works do, as is the custom to bring unusual drinks where i work. Burns like the fires of Hades (but in a good way). Thoroughly recommended (good with mixers too) but bear in mind the half size!
flavour_note: Grass, Oil, Black Pepper, Apple

name: George Dickel 8 Year OldSmall Batch Bourbon
characters: Vanilla, Nutmeg, Cherry, Apple, Cinnamon, Stewed Fruit
flavour_note: Vanilla, Nutmeg, Cherry, Apple, Cinnamon, Stewed Fruit

name: Wilderness Trail Bottled In Bond Small Batch Bourbon
flavour_note: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Caramel, Apple

name: Willett's Pot Still Reserve Single Barrel BourbonMagnum
reviews:
We were introduced to this in a hotel in Kentucky when we enquired what we should drink.
Back in the uk we have purchased both the normal and large bottle. Always a good drink.  I prefer with a few cubes of ice as we would have in the USA. || The first time I tried this was at a local gathering and I was blown away. In fact the whiskey I normally drank was nothing compared to this.  Well worth it and really up there in quality. || Any Bourbon with higher strength of alcohol always attracts me. Tried this one and not at all disappointed. Smooth, long finish with hint of lemon, vanila and ofcourse dried fruits. Loved this one..

name: Very Old Barton 100 Proof Bourbon
reviews: This is a great “value” whiskey - as long as you’re buying it in the US where it is $15 (yes, FIFTEEN) a bottle. How on EARTH it can be £84, and thus more than the likes of Eagle Rare, Knob Creek and even Wild Turkey Rare Breed is beyond belief. || Absolutely fabulous Bourbon. So easy to drink and enjoy. Chill time. || Hands down the best bourbon for the price. At roughly $15 dollars or less for a bottle, it hands down the best bang for the buck. || Good Bourbon & especially good price. I'll go to this Bourbon to save my Sazerac, Blanton's, Eagle Rare which are hard to get ahold of & not feel like Im giving up on Quality! || Great Bourbon for the price !!!!

name: Green River Full Proof Bourbon
characters: Leather, Coconut, Cherry, Milk Chocolate, Mint, Cinnamon
flavour_note: Leather, Coconut, Cherry, Milk Chocolate, Mint, Cinnamon

name: Ben Holladay Wheated Bourbon Bottled in Bond
flavour_note: Caramel, Apple, Vanilla, Cinnamon, Cherry

name: Knob Creek 9 Year Old
reviews: One of the two whiskeys I enjoyed the most, other one was Amrut Fusion. || My new favourite Bourbon. Great flavour with a long finish . || Great bourbon - Makes a fantastic Old Fashioned! Agree with the earlier review; this is a step up from Woodford Reserve. || No complaints, just not good enough for me to get it again.
flavour_note: Hazelnut, Oak, Apple, Vanilla

name: Wild Turkey Rye
nose: Big, big spicy aromas of caraway seed and plus a breezy freshness.
palate: Warm and mouthfilling, with a lovely dry, characterful spiciness, with some black pepper and notes of caraway seed, rye and fennel seed, plus some faint toffee sweetness.
reviews: This is an excellent rye. Spicy sipping whiskey. Great on the rocks. Unpretentious. || Update - I have since tried the Hudson Manhattan Rye (very disappointing, especially at the price) and Bulleit Bourbon (@28% rye and a more mellow pepper finish than the Wild Turkey): 1st Bulleit, 2nd Wild Turkey and (a very distant) 3rd Hudson Manhattan. Best Whisky Mac so far? For a shot, 1/2 oz Lidl single malt (blue), 1/2 oz Bulleit bourbon, 1/4 oz Rochester ginger. (Using Teachers / Wild Turkey Rye / Rochester in the same proportions is a pretty good alternative - less mellow, more fiery.) || My first try of rye, prompted by a love of a whisky mac followed by a red rye beer. So this Wild Turkey rye was in effect competing with a Teachers/Rochester ginger wine 50:25. Did the same 50:25 whisky/ginger here: liked the nose with the rye better, but found the finish a little too peppery compared to the creamy finish you get with the Teachers. 3/5 for a whisky mac probably isn't that bad really! || Perhaps a little less smooth than expected, having had various Wild Turkey products over the years, but nevertheless a most enjoyable Rye. I'm having a sip now and reckon it benefits from a little dilution, as compared to neat. || My first go on a Rye, glad I tried it but I don't think Rye is to my taste. I have had a few other WT variations and this is my least favourite, due to me not liking Rye rather than this not being great.
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Black Pepper, Vanilla, Leather Big, big spicy aromas of caraway seed and plus a breezy freshness. Warm and mouthfilling, with a lovely dry, characterful spiciness, with some black pepper and notes of caraway seed, rye and fennel seed, plus some faint toffee sweetness. Spicy and peppery.

name: Heaven's Door Tennessee Bourbon
characters: Caramel, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Malt, Dried Fruit
reviews: Tasty Juice || Meh. At this price I wasn’t expecting Pappy Van, but there really are so many better bourbons in the £70-90 range. Very intense vanilla nuttiness, but let down by its raw, unbalanced alcohol. Burns like a Bulleit as it goes down… || Sweet & smooth.  Everything said above is there; definitely can taste the oak, sweet vanilla, and hints of a bread like flavor.  Finish is great; leaves you nice and warm. Highly recommended ??
flavour_note: Caramel, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Malt, Dried Fruit

name: Strathisla 200715 Year Old Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
characters: Sultana, Apple, Vanilla, Banana, Pear, Biscuits
nose: Victoria sponge cake with raspberry jam, spiced shortbread, sultanas, baked apple, candied orange peel and ripe pear. The vanilla from the sponge becomes light custard and apples become apple pie. Creaminess builds along with banana hints.
palate: A big hit of spice and fruit leads to barley sugar sweetness, orange milk-chocolate and lots of orchard fruit – fresh and cooked very ripe apples and pears. Garibaldi biscuits develop, along with berry fruit: blueberries and blackcurrants.
finish: Spiced custard and shortbread with banana hints.
reviews: well well it's a braw dram Strathisla one of oldest in Scotland. || I bought this bottle some time ago and meant to leave a review but things happened and it slipped my mind. It's a stunning malt, I'm so pleased I treated myself to a bottle. I agree with all the tasting notes. The only comment I would make, for me, at 60%, I needed to add a small splash of water. It opens up beautifully. || This whiskey is so beautiful it is really a work or art
flavour_note: Sultana, Apple, Vanilla, Banana, Pear, Biscuits Victoria sponge cake with raspberry jam, spiced shortbread, sultanas, baked apple, candied orange peel and ripe pear. The vanilla from the sponge becomes light custard and apples become apple pie. Creaminess builds along with banana hints. A big hit of spice and fruit leads to barley sugar sweetness, orange milk-chocolate and lots of orchard fruit – fresh and cooked very ripe apples and pears. Garibaldi biscuits develop, along with berry fruit: blueberries and blackcurrants. Spiced custard and shortbread with banana hints.

name: Glenfiddich 21 Year Old Chinese New Year 2024
characters: Honeycomb, Apple, Milk Chocolate, Coffee, Clove
flavour_note: Honeycomb, Apple, Milk Chocolate, Coffee, Clove

name: Glentauchers 200913 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory for The Whisky Exchange
characters: Fruit Cake, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Apple, Biscuits
nose: Cinder toffee and baked apples with baking spice. The toffee slowly becomes chocolate-covered, with brown sugar and a touch of rye crispbread. Dark fruit and spice notes build – speculaas biscuits, dates, treacle toffee and a touch of black liquorice.
palate: Intense, with dark sugars and lots of spice initially. That calms to reveal fruit-studded bread, dark chocolate and baked apples. Eccles cakes and buttered rum follow: intense, dark and spicy.
reviews: This is a wonderful dram. This is something to enjoy over time at the 64.1% ABV, it is definitely a sipper. It coats your tongue with sweetness and leaves a lasting taste. Add a drop of water to open it up (I added just a couple of drops and let it rest for about 15 minutes). I really enjoy it, I do not have a sophisticated palette as veteran whisky drinker, but this awesome in my opinion.
flavour_note: Fruit Cake, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Apple, Biscuits Cinder toffee and baked apples with baking spice. The toffee slowly becomes chocolate-covered, with brown sugar and a touch of rye crispbread. Dark fruit and spice notes build – speculaas biscuits, dates, treacle toffee and a touch of black liquorice. Intense, with dark sugars and lots of spice initially. That calms to reveal fruit-studded bread, dark chocolate and baked apples. Eccles cakes and buttered rum follow: intense, dark and spicy. Brown sugar and spice linger.

name: Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask
characters: Rum, Honey, Raisins, Toffee, Nutmeg, Cream
nose: Brown sugar, butter and nutmeg – buttered rum mix, before you add the rum. With that, there's shortbread, golden syrup and sweet Muscat grapes.
palate: Apples, lemons, icing sugar and brown toast, with syrup, caramel and toffee popcorn.
finish: White toast with Golden Syrup, freshly sawn oak and a touch of stewed apple.
reviews: Very nice. Brilliant taste> || Absolutely my favorite scotch! Perfect! || Just bought this yesterday and was amazed by its complexity. Right out of the gate it was a burst of that famous Balvenie scotch with a flavorful hit of toasty rum, and a creamy finish with candy like taste..kinda. I love it, it’s a keeper for sure. || This speyside needs to have its own candle fragrance. My favorite scotch ever in terms of the nose. Wonderful notes of toffee and banana wrapped in vanilla and oak. Just splendid. Taste is very good as well, with a good peppery finish capped with more vanilla. Excellent whisky || Yes excellent
flavour_note: Rum, Honey, Raisins, Toffee, Nutmeg, Cream Brown sugar, butter and nutmeg – buttered rum mix, before you add the rum. With that, there's shortbread, golden syrup and sweet Muscat grapes. Apples, lemons, icing sugar and brown toast, with syrup, caramel and toffee popcorn. White toast with Golden Syrup, freshly sawn oak and a touch of stewed apple.

name: Balvenie 12 Year Old DoubleWood
characters: Cinnamon, Raspberry, Milk Chocolate, Black Pepper, Stewed Fruit
nose: Sweet fruit and oloroso sherry notes, layered with honey and vanilla.
palate: Smooth and mellow with beautifully combined flavours – nutty sweetness, cinnamon spiciness and a delicately proportioned layer of sherry.
reviews: Excellent! Perfect for a 65th Birthday toast ! Cheers! To Kevin (Dez) Williams ! Here’s to many more!! || I’ve tried so many brands of single malts, ever since I’ve tasted Balvenie, I’ve started loving it. It’s so smooth & light. || I have taster many single malts in my time. However, I constantly come back to Balvenie 12 Yr Doublewood. I won’t turn down the 17 or 21 for obvious reasons. IMHO, the taste of this scotch is superb. || Not overly complex, but unbelievably smooth. Very enjoyable. || well for my opinion this is one of the best malts for the category below 50 euros. I am a whisky drinker for 30 years and tasted over 50 different brands so far. Of course my No 1 is the Macallan 12 double oak for this price range. But this is very close... lovely dram.. balance is spot on. cheers
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Raspberry, Milk Chocolate, Black Pepper, Stewed Fruit Sweet fruit and oloroso sherry notes, layered with honey and vanilla. Smooth and mellow with beautifully combined flavours – nutty sweetness, cinnamon spiciness and a delicately proportioned layer of sherry. Long and warming.

name: Glenlivet 18 Year Old Batch Reserve
characters: Raisins, Honey, Malt, Nutmeg, Clove, Orange
nose: Rich, plush aromas of malt, biscuits and toffee.
palate: The rich toffee and malt continues on to the palate, with toasty, spicy oak balancing things out. Well-made dram, with everything in proportion.
finish: Sweet spice and toasty oak, with a malty backbone that persists.
reviews: Not the award winning Glenlivet 18 bottled at 43%. The newest iteration is a huge dissapointment. Do not waste your money on this. || Its no terrible but simply not as good as the previous expression which was more robust and complex, it changed early 2020 or should i say 18 years ago the choice was made. Really should be reviews for a new/different whisky. || A shadow of its former self. At 40%, the Batch Reserve is thinner and lacking in the complexity of the previous version. It's really a whole different whisky. || It has gone down beautifully- very very smooth and looking forward to enjoying a glass for New Year’s Eve tonight! || A delightful whisky, definitely one to add to anyone’s collection. Plenty of depth
flavour_note: Raisins, Honey, Malt, Nutmeg, Clove, Orange Rich, plush aromas of malt, biscuits and toffee. The rich toffee and malt continues on to the palate, with toasty, spicy oak balancing things out. Well-made dram, with everything in proportion. Sweet spice and toasty oak, with a malty backbone that persists.

name: Cardhu 200811 Year Old Special Releases 2020
characters: Lemon, Orange, Ginger, Toffee, Custard, Honey
nose: Crunchy green apples and just-ripe white pears. Toffee notes build, with heather honey and crunchy barley sugar not far behind. Green herbal notes develop, with sage and rosemary alongside fresh lemon peel and candied orange.
palate: Toffee leads – Highland Toffee bars with zesty lemon and singed orange. The toffee becomes Crunchie innards with a drizzle of honey, a pinch of ginger, spicy baked apples and a dusting of cocoa.
finish: Burnt toffee and baked apples fade to expose gravelly minerality, custard and spice.
reviews: I am a self confessed Cardhu fan. The opportunity to try this 11 year old (2008) was nicely placed before me by The Exchange. It has greater strength to what I am normally used to, and the taste was excellent for me. So I will steadily enjoy, as I sip along during my future evenings. Thank you for supplying a very enjoyable dram ( in my opinion) As always, it arrived perfectly packaged, in good time. Until the next opportunity to try another Cardhu, many thanks. || Bought for my son as a birthday gift. He’s quite a connoisseur when it comes to whisky and he absolutely loved it! || I was not impressed by this whisky. It could by that my palette has not matured sufficiently to appreciate the taste. I found the nose quite ethanol dominate, and the taste was harsh. I will try again in few months again to see if my palette matured to appreciate the whisky. Fingers crossed for the future. || One of the nicest whisky’s I’ve tasted! Bought for me as a 40th birthday present I wasn’t expecting such a flavour profile from an 11 yo. I will soon be getting another bottle.
flavour_note: Lemon, Orange, Ginger, Toffee, Custard, Honey Crunchy green apples and just-ripe white pears. Toffee notes build, with heather honey and crunchy barley sugar not far behind. Green herbal notes develop, with sage and rosemary alongside fresh lemon peel and candied orange. Toffee leads – Highland Toffee bars with zesty lemon and singed orange. The toffee becomes Crunchie innards with a drizzle of honey, a pinch of ginger, spicy baked apples and a dusting of cocoa. Burnt toffee and baked apples fade to expose gravelly minerality, custard and spice.

name: Glenfiddich 18 Year Old
reviews: I love Glenfiddich 18Y one of the my favourite whiskey. All time. || Better than the 12 and 15! Not the worse or the best ive had. Its the whiskey you would give to guests who think you are fancy || This 18 malt whiskey is absolutely divine , so smooth, totally recommend it || wayyyy better than the glenfiddich 15. It is fuller and more complex. It has the elegant taste and aroma that the 15 doesn't have. || Beautiful. Refined, complex taste yet not overly saturated or bold.
flavour_note: Apple, Pear, Oak, Raisins, Honeysuckle

name: Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask
characters: Vanilla, Custard, Orange, Raisins, Ginger, Nutmeg
palate: Wood spices (ginger and nutmeg), citrus, caramel, raisins and resinous.
finish: Oak lingers, warm, sweet and drying.
reviews: Beautiful whiskey on its own smooth and warming ,tried with ice but made it worse and why waste something so good with a mixer , will be buying more. || I had this whisky over ice and enjoyed the fruity and slightly spicy taste. It was warming and reasonably mild in the mouth but a little harsh in the throat. It would make a lovely gift, but I wouldn't buy it for myself unless on offer. || A smooth whisky with fruity and caramel flavours. Not too harsh and great over ice. Highly recommended to try this from the Macallan range. || Light colour and thin on flavour. A bit disappointing. || Maple colour with a brandy base aroma and caramel after tones. A smooth taste within the mouth but develops a sharpness as it goes down, not uncomfortable but noticeable. No real distinct taste notes other than the hint of brandy and is very comparable to other scotch whiskies previously experienced (scotch not being my favourite). Based on this I would not buy again but would still recommend to others who enjoy scotch whiskies.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Custard, Orange, Raisins, Ginger, Nutmeg Wood spices (ginger and nutmeg), citrus, caramel, raisins and resinous. Oak lingers, warm, sweet and drying.

name: Speyside (M) 200915 Year Old Signatory Small Batch #18
characters: Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Caramel, Papaya, Pecan
reviews: Excellent!
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Caramel, Papaya, Pecan

name: Aberlour 12 Year Old Double CaskGift Box
characters: Dried Fruit, Custard, Apricot, Apple, Dark Chocolate, Honeycomb
reviews: This a great choice and also makes a fantastic Rusty Nail. It is a staple whisky for my cabinet. || This is a mellow dram and easy on the pallet. It has a great sherried infusion and I can definitely taste pear in the background. I am a lover of Bunnahabhain and Glenallachie but this whisky is definitely worth a place in my cabinet
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Custard, Apricot, Apple, Dark Chocolate, Honeycomb

name: Dalmunach 6 Year OldWulver Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
characters: Vanilla, Apple, Pear, Peach, Lemon, Hazelnut
nose: Red apples, white peach, vanilla ice cream, orange chocolate and homemade shortbread.
palate: Stewed pears, honeyed apricots, lemon curd, hazelnut, marzipan and cinnamon spice.
reviews: delicious, vanilla ice cream and orchard fruits- good abv for the price and v complex for the young distillery - would buy again || Surprisingly enjoyable. Found it a smooth and easy drink. || quite young but pack a hefty punch for the price. not a bad deal for £60 || A very interesting whisky from a new distillery.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Apple, Pear, Peach, Lemon, Hazelnut Red apples, white peach, vanilla ice cream, orange chocolate and homemade shortbread. Stewed pears, honeyed apricots, lemon curd, hazelnut, marzipan and cinnamon spice. Medium, sweet and smooth.

name: Glenallachie 15 Year OldSherry Cask
characters: Butterscotch, Raisins, Banana, Orange, Cinnamon, Nutmeg
reviews: One of the first whiskys I tried and a firm favourite to this day. || Simply excellent. Best value for money || Tried this for the first time last night (an early Christmas present), and wow, this is an excellent malt. If you like your sherry cask malts, then you'll like this,,, rich, sweet, and deep,,,, sublime. Well done all at Glenallachie! || A very special whisky, excellent. || Imagine if you took a solid sherry bomb, gave her some good ole sleeping pills, and then, after she wakes, you give her the biggest dose of steroids you can find; essentially turning her into a sherry NUKE… If you imagined correctly, this dram is what should come to mind! She’s a slammer
flavour_note: Butterscotch, Raisins, Banana, Orange, Cinnamon, Nutmeg

name: Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak
characters: Dried Fruit, Sherry, Smoke, Plums, Prunes, Oak
nose: Vanilla with hints of ginger, dried fruits, sherry sweetness and wood smoke
palate: Deliciously smooth, with rich dried fruits and sherry, balanced with wood smoke and spice
finish: Sweet toffee, dried fruits, lingering wood smoke and spice
reviews: I can say that it was far below my expectations for the price. It is not hard to find whiskey with this flavor for half the price. Although it is delicious, it is a whisky without depth. || Wow a great whisky really smooth lovely flavour ticks all the boxes 10 stars || It’s a Macallan so you know it’s going to be good - for me just a bit too much sherry. I’ll probably stick to the plain old double-cask next time || A real sherrybomb || Unbelievable. ..smooth....just luxurious! !!
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Sherry, Smoke, Plums, Prunes, Oak Vanilla with hints of ginger, dried fruits, sherry sweetness and wood smoke Deliciously smooth, with rich dried fruits and sherry, balanced with wood smoke and spice Sweet toffee, dried fruits, lingering wood smoke and spice

name: Macallan 15 Year Old Double Cask
characters: Ginger, Orange, Raisins, Honey, Apple, Milk Chocolate
nose: Dried fruit, toffee and vanilla with smooth oak and baked apple. Balanced with notes of honey and chocolate.
palate: Sweet raisin and sultana builds with hints of vanilla, wood spice and citrus.
finish: Warm with ginger turning to caramel and citrus, with a lingering and creamy mouth feel.
reviews: Slightly darker single malt whiskey, quite a distink and heady smell. Very smooth with a stonger and longer lasting after taste. Personally prefered the "Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask" || A nice balance of all the flavours but did find this a but thin compared to other Macallan whisky. I think other brands at this price point have a lot more flavour, nice to try but don't think I would have again. || I am half way through a bottle and I will start off by saying it will not be replaced with another bottle. I have found it uninspiring to drink it is by no means a bad whiskey it carries a lot of lovely flavours but I the whole experience a tad thin. I can’t help but feel that if this had came out of a different distillery at this price point then it would be a bit of a laughing stock. || I’m a ‘regular’ whisky drinker and drank this neat to start with, walnut in colour with a very similar brandy / caramel aroma to the Macallan Double Cask 12 year but rounder and slightly more bodied. However, a harsh whisky both in the mouth and as it goes down, which was completely unexpected as the 12 year was, surprisingly, smoother, this then had to be mixed to soften it. Based on this I would not buy again or recommend. || Very good whiskey. Smooth and great taste. But, price is too high. It should be one third less at least, and then would get 5 stars. For now only 3.
flavour_note: Ginger, Orange, Raisins, Honey, Apple, Milk Chocolate Dried fruit, toffee and vanilla with smooth oak and baked apple. Balanced with notes of honey and chocolate. Sweet raisin and sultana builds with hints of vanilla, wood spice and citrus. Warm with ginger turning to caramel and citrus, with a lingering and creamy mouth feel.

name: Macallan Art Is The Flower
characters: Crystallised ginger, Apple, Black tea, Oak, Toffee
flavour_note: Crystallised ginger, Apple, Black tea, Oak, Toffee

name: Benriach 201410 Year Old 100 Proof Exceptional Edition 40 Signatory
characters: Cherry, Dark Chocolate, Resin, Clove, Orange
flavour_note: Cherry, Dark Chocolate, Resin, Clove, Orange

name: Glen Grant 200022 Year Old Sherry Finish Signatory for The Whisky Exchange
characters: Toffee, Prunes, Fruit Cake, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Blackcurrant
nose: Singed toffee, baked apples and prunes to start. Malt loaf and dates develop, along with a touch of butter, liquorice and damp oak. Concentrated fruitiness continues to build: dried cherries and cranberries with blackcurrants.
palate: Blackcurrants and raising jam kick things off, with brown sugar and cinnamon, dates and buttered malt loaf. The fruit builds, as on the nose, although with added dark chocolate and dried citrus peel: orange and lemon.
finish: Dried oranges, chocolate and cake spice lingers.
flavour_note: Toffee, Prunes, Fruit Cake, Dark Chocolate, Cinnamon, Blackcurrant Singed toffee, baked apples and prunes to start. Malt loaf and dates develop, along with a touch of butter, liquorice and damp oak. Concentrated fruitiness continues to build: dried cherries and cranberries with blackcurrants. Blackcurrants and raising jam kick things off, with brown sugar and cinnamon, dates and buttered malt loaf. The fruit builds, as on the nose, although with added dark chocolate and dried citrus peel: orange and lemon. Dried oranges, chocolate and cake spice lingers.

name: Glenfarclas 25 Year Old London EditionExclusive to The Whisky Exchange
characters: Apple, Brioche, Oak, Fruit Cake, Raisins, Coffee
nose: Meadow flowers and barley sugar sit on top of a pile of sultanas and baked apples. Fragrant wax-polished oak follows, with freshly scraped vanilla pods and a touch of pine sap. Buttered brioche and fruit loaf notes develop along with mixed peel and a hint of cream. Hiding underneath is a bed of Eccles-cake raisins and earthy ground coffee.
palate: Rich and oily, with well-fruited sponge cake leading to salted caramel and old oak tables. Singed, buttered toast and buttery pastry are wrapped around fruity espresso and raisins. Dried apple rings liberally spread with blackcurrant jam and sprinkled with brown sugar sit in the middle. Behind everything is an elegant waxiness and freshly polished pine boards.
finish: Lingering sweet spice, light char, sultanas and a touch of hay and honeysuckle.
reviews: Top Notch Dram. This was actually my First Glenfarclas. It is perfection. For the price for a 25 year old a sure bet. || The taste and the strength well balanced. I would prefer it to have a bit more smoke in it, but that is just my personal preference || Personally, I wasn’t so mad on this. I expected more from the age and strength. A bit weak. || Love the 25 year Scotch! Great nose of fruit and caramel. Smooth but lingering with just a bit of smoke. I have tried several better grade Scotches and I would put this one up against any of them. I wish they were more available but I will seek them out to buy them. || Great taste, unbelievable value for 25 year old.
flavour_note: Apple, Brioche, Oak, Fruit Cake, Raisins, Coffee Meadow flowers and barley sugar sit on top of a pile of sultanas and baked apples. Fragrant wax-polished oak follows, with freshly scraped vanilla pods and a touch of pine sap. Buttered brioche and fruit loaf notes develop along with mixed peel and a hint of cream. Hiding underneath is a bed of Eccles-cake raisins and earthy ground coffee. Rich and oily, with well-fruited sponge cake leading to salted caramel and old oak tables. Singed, buttered toast and buttery pastry are wrapped around fruity espresso and raisins. Dried apple rings liberally spread with blackcurrant jam and sprinkled with brown sugar sit in the middle. Behind everything is an elegant waxiness and freshly polished pine boards. Lingering sweet spice, light char, sultanas and a touch of hay and honeysuckle.

name: Glenfarclas 10 Year Old
reviews: first time trying glenfarclas bought the 10 and 15. Have to say I absolutely love both, very smooth but full of flavour and complexity. I actually prefer the 10 yr old to the 15 yr old, the 10 is a superb day to day whisky for the festive season || Just a very nice 10 yr old whisky here..with very nice flavours.Recommended..as are most Glenfarclas! || Nice dram - smooth with a sweetness. Bottle and label design make for a good present! || Fantastic value for money you really can’t go wrong with this whisky, a timeless classic that you can have sat on the side and drink whenever || This gorgeous whiskey will blow your sock off. I have only just discovered Glenfarclas after years of drinking malt whiskeys and as regards value for money, there is no better. The 25 year old is fantastic as well.
flavour_note: Malt, Raisins, Honey, Cinnamon

name: Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old
characters: Honey, Toffee, Cinnamon, Heather, Pear, Almond
nose: Clean and fresh, with heather honey, pears, a touch of toffee and a soft floral note.
palate: Bright and fruity, but also rich, with notes of steamed syrup pudding and sponge cake, with a little cinnamon and nutmeg.
finish: Just enough spice to match the fruit. Lovely balance.
reviews:
Splendid! 
Simply that. || It's an all time superb single malt whisky. || One of my favorites || There is no such thing has a bad whisky, just different if made well.
Dalwhinnie is very smooth but when compared to teachers blended scotch whisky , 
teachers has the edge on flavor and price both being a smooth whisky. 
My son bought me Dalwinnie for my birthday 24th December . Which i enjoyed but for the price , teachers would have been just as good if not had the edge. 
I with politeness advise the producers to look at their product and add some thing or use better barrels .  The king is in the all together.  Advice is a gift , if listened too.
HAPPY  NEW YEAR . CHEERS. || One of my favorites for sure!
flavour_note: Honey, Toffee, Cinnamon, Heather, Pear, Almond Clean and fresh, with heather honey, pears, a touch of toffee and a soft floral note. Bright and fruity, but also rich, with notes of steamed syrup pudding and sponge cake, with a little cinnamon and nutmeg. Just enough spice to match the fruit. Lovely balance.

name: Speyside (M) 201014 Year Old Small Batch #16 Signatory
characters: Dark Chocolate, Sherry, Dried Fruit, Apple, Oak
flavour_note: Dark Chocolate, Sherry, Dried Fruit, Apple, Oak

name: Glenfiddich 21 Year OldGran Reserva Rum Cask Finish
characters: Rum, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Apple, Butterscotch, Coffee
nose: Rich with a brown sugar / toffee apple character. Also hints of milky coffee.
palate: Rich, with characteristic nuts and cooked fruit. As with the nose, the rum finish has lent greater weight and a noticeable sweetness. The oak is prominent without dominating the lively spirit. Dessert flavours – chocolate sponge cake, toffee pudding, crème brulée, even a hint of pannacotta.
finish: Medium length, doesn’t outstay its welcome.
reviews: The best scotch I have ever had, and I am not a scotch snob! || Amazing taste, really good for the price. I highly recommend || I bought this for birthday. A real disappointment. Not very nice. I was surprised how poor it was. Luckily I got Macallan rare cask black as well which was amazing. The Glenfiddich was not nice || My husband was delighted with this gift and said it was one of the best Whiskey I had bought him. Packaging was lovely and well worth the money as it definitely was a luxury item. || This is one of my favourite whisky's, it's a beautiful colour with a rich and intense flavour that's smooth and enticing . The after taste is almost sweet and makes you want to take another sip.. A great addition to anyones collection.
flavour_note: Rum, Dried Fruit, Dark Chocolate, Apple, Butterscotch, Coffee Rich with a brown sugar / toffee apple character. Also hints of milky coffee. Rich, with characteristic nuts and cooked fruit. As with the nose, the rum finish has lent greater weight and a noticeable sweetness. The oak is prominent without dominating the lively spirit. Dessert flavours – chocolate sponge cake, toffee pudding, crème brulée, even a hint of pannacotta. Medium length, doesn’t outstay its welcome.

name: Macallan 18 Year OldSherry Oak 2023 Release
reviews: Deep rich colour and heady aroma, drank over ice. Quite strong sherry flavour from the oak cask. Not my favourite, personally I found the Macallan Double Cask 12 year smoother and more enjoyable. || I am not a seasoned whisky drinker. I tried this as it comes and I found it very harsh. It made my mouth and nose tingle, and it was difficult to concentrate on the flavour. || Nice colour and aroma with the Spices in this whisky. Great over ice and not too harsh. The sherry taste comes through and tastes perfect. || This whisky was light mahogany in colour with a sherry aroma, another harsh whiskey both in the mouth and as it goes down, much like the Macallan Double Cask 15 year old with the Macallan Double Cask 12 year still being smoother, for my taste that is, this had to be mixed to soften it as well. Based on this I would not buy again or recommend. || A luscious, creamy, rich and almost thick liqueur-like drink, with hints of ginger, spice, and liquorice.
flavour_note: Dried Fruit, Ginger, Orange, Raisins

name: Benromach 10 Year Old
characters: Liquorice root, Apple, White Pepper, Malt, Smoke
nose: You know what, this greasiness and this mineral smokiness just cannot not make us think of modern Springbank, which can’t be bad news. I find some smoked tea, touches of truffles, graphite oil, quite some fresh barley (or is that porridge?) and quite some raw wool and grass. Old school for sure!
palate: The liquorice and green apple continue from the nose, joined by a maltiness, smoke and spicy cardamom and white pepper.
finish: Quite long, smoky, with notes of agaves and minerals.
reviews: Excellent if you like the flavour profiles shown. Wouldn't say it was a daily sipper but definitely a special occasion dram, a very well balanced whisky. || A good SM for a great price. Mildly smoky with a strong peppery bite, Finishes with a long liquorice note. Well worth the purchase. || Rather good..very sherry,wisp of smoke and maybe liquorice,so everyone wont like this..but overall rather good..think I actually prefer this to Cask Strength,which I tried in October. || Having had a gift of the Benromach 10 yrs aged 43% it's an absolutely lovely smooth Malt Whisky to have with 'very very' little water. Will definitely buy this product again. || Wow! Tried it in a bar in Pitlochry, brought a bottle home. A fantastic balanced whisky that I’ll buy again and again
flavour_note: Liquorice root, Apple, White Pepper, Malt, Smoke You know what, this greasiness and this mineral smokiness just cannot not make us think of modern Springbank, which can’t be bad news. I find some smoked tea, touches of truffles, graphite oil, quite some fresh barley (or is that porridge?) and quite some raw wool and grass. Old school for sure! The liquorice and green apple continue from the nose, joined by a maltiness, smoke and spicy cardamom and white pepper. Quite long, smoky, with notes of agaves and minerals.

name: Cardhu Gold ReserveGame of Thrones House Targaryen
characters: Clove, Apple, Butter, Honey, Oak, Cinnamon
nose: The golden amber appearance is reinforced on the nose which delivers soft honeyed aromas with a gentle wisp of toasted oak.
palate: On the palate is opens with baked apple & warming spices like cinnamon and allspice that then quickly evolves into a rich caramel character with hints of clove and red apples.
finish: It has a gentle malty biscuit finish.
food_paring: Tart Tatin, Dim Sum, Fried Chicken
reviews: This has been my go to tipple for the past 6 years First tried it while on holiday in zakynthos. Soon found myself buying it when I returned home. A lovely smooth drink that I appreciate as a night cap || Super tasty. Buttery mouth feel and complex sweetness. I was surprised the Targaryen House whisky didn't have more smoke intensity... But I guess that's about right for a Cardhu. I recommend buying a bottle if you can still find one.
flavour_note: Clove, Apple, Butter, Honey, Oak, Cinnamon The golden amber appearance is reinforced on the nose which delivers soft honeyed aromas with a gentle wisp of toasted oak. On the palate is opens with baked apple & warming spices like cinnamon and allspice that then quickly evolves into a rich caramel character with hints of clove and red apples. It has a gentle malty biscuit finish.

name: Balvenie 12 Year OldSweet Toast Of American Oak
characters: Vanilla, Honey, Lemon, Cinnamon, Orange, Toffee
reviews: Very distinctive taste, might be a little sweet on the palate for some but pretty much exactly what I was looking for. || Too rich to be enjoyable after 1 glass. Tastes very sweet and syrup like || This is a really wonderful Scotch. Probably beats out most 14 year olds, 15 year olds, and even 18 year olds. Its really that good. My only issue is I CANNOT Find it anymore. Need help to locate this great bottle. I am in Massachusetts, USA || The best 12 year malt I’ve ever had, puts most 15 and many 18 year olds to shame. It’s a melt in your mouth explosion of citrus and rich chocolatey notes. Incredible stuff. || Probably my fave to date. Love it.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Honey, Lemon, Cinnamon, Orange, Toffee

name: Macallan 200618 Year Old Cask #9620 Speymalt Gordon & MacPhail
characters: Dark Chocolate, Orange, Cinnamon, Toffee, Ginger, Banana
flavour_note: Dark Chocolate, Orange, Cinnamon, Toffee, Ginger, Banana

name: Balvenie 12 Year OldDouble Wood Small Bottle
characters: Honey, Vanilla, Sherry, Raisins, Hazelnut, Cinnamon
nose: Sweet fruit and Oloroso sherry notes, layered with honey and vanilla.
reviews: This is my staple. I always have a bottle of this on the go. || Smooth with a lovely finish. One of my favorites. || I have tasted it presented to me from US. I think it is the best Scotch Whisky I have ever tasted. It is so smooth. || Very new to whisky so picked up a 5cl of this along with others. Was very impressed, the first thing I got on the nose was the sweet sherry, very smooth taste too. Not fond of the bitter flavour that some scotch’s have, however this wasn’t as completely different. Sweet and friendly. || It warmed me up. I loved it. I first had it in a restaurant and was very happy the barman chose this one. My new favorite
flavour_note: Honey, Vanilla, Sherry, Raisins, Hazelnut, Cinnamon Sweet fruit and Oloroso sherry notes, layered with honey and vanilla. Long and Warming.

name: Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera
characters: Sherry, Oak, Marzipan, Cinnamon, Ginger, Apple
nose: An intriguingly complex aroma. Sweet heather honey and vanilla fudge combined with rich dark fruits.
reviews: No expert but trying to learn, smooth and satisfying. During mine with a little water. || I can say categorically that you cannot rate any whisky without taking into consideration the price. I used to be able to pick this up a couple of years ago for under £40.00. At that price absolutely 5 star. But nowadays I'm not so sure. Many whisky's are superb over £40.00 and Glenfiddich 15 is one of them. However price dictates 4 stars. || A bit less powerful on the nose than what I was expecting, almost underwhelming. A very smooth tasting whisky though, but with enough sweet fruity sherry influence and subtle complexity to keep it interesting. A good day to day sipping whisky, this is similar to the rich oak I had a couple of years ago but I think I preferred that just slightly, it had a bit more going on with the extra complexity from the wood influence. Overall I can’t complain too much, it goes down an absolute treat by the fire with a mince pie :) || Im no whisky tasting expert, but I like to look at the tasting notes and see if I can find them. Im really disappointed with the 15. Its pretty bland in my opinion. Not finding any of the tasting notes. Im not getting much on the nose either. I prefer the 12 year bottle. || A straight up sherried whisky, not bad but nothing great, next.
flavour_note: Sherry, Oak, Marzipan, Cinnamon, Ginger, Apple An intriguingly complex aroma. Sweet heather honey and vanilla fudge combined with rich dark fruits. Satisfyingly rich with lingering sweetness.

name: Speyside (GL) 16 Year Old100 Proof Exceptional Edition 8 Signatory
characters: Dates, Sultana, Leather, Toast, Prunes, Milk Chocolate
flavour_note: Dates, Sultana, Leather, Toast, Prunes, Milk Chocolate

name: Mortlach 15 Year OldGame of Thrones Six Kingdoms
characters: Clove, Raisins, Apple, Dates, Dark Chocolate, Fruit Cake
food_paring: Fondue, Mushroom Cream Sauce, Roasted Aubergine
reviews: Immensely enjoyable! That said I got it in a sale, if I had paid more than £85 I might have thought less of it. It is rich, satisfying, interesting, complex with dried fruit flavours and maybe some orange notes. I am not doing it justice with that description, but it is delicious! || I bought this as the F&F Mortlach 16yr is probably my all time favourite dram. It is still a rich, oily and fruity malt but not as sweet and Xmas cakey as the F&F. All in all I'm enjoying it, except for all the online slagging off it's getting on the whisky appreciation pages of social media. Ignore the crappy hype and try a bottle. Judged on its own merits it is a fine malt without a doubt, it just has a big name to live up to
flavour_note: Clove, Raisins, Apple, Dates, Dark Chocolate, Fruit Cake

name: Glenfiddich 23 Year OldGrand Cru
nose: Soft lemon and pink lady apple notes sit alongside a heavier creaminess. Marzipan and honey brioche follow. The apple becomes more intense with time, picking up grapes, floral honey and the merest hint of red fruits along the way.
palate: Oily. Sweet, honeyed fruits and a rush of cream, then baked apple tart with extra apple skins and flecks of spice. The sweet nuttiness from the nose is present too.
finish: Dry and short, with notes of hazelnuts, brioche and honeysuckle.
reviews: Very nice whisky. However, nothing notable for the price. There are many better whiskies for much less. || Yes, I tried this product, and it was fantastic || I bought this as a gift and my friend was over the moon happy and excited. He LOVES it. The shipping was great as well. Thank you. || This is a delightful expression from Glenfiddich. Don't let the branding on the bottle throw you - this is a beautifully light and floral, classically Glenfiddich dram that is boosted by the patisserie notes. || The packaging alone is something diffent and a far cry from a bottle in a tube. I was quite impressed with the instant creamy mouth feel with sweet notes but not cloying then onto a crisp dry finish. More than what I would normally spend on a bottle but pleased that on the occasion I did it matched my expectations.
flavour_note: Brioche, Apple, Peach, Biscuits Soft lemon and pink lady apple notes sit alongside a heavier creaminess. Marzipan and honey brioche follow. The apple becomes more intense with time, picking up grapes, floral honey and the merest hint of red fruits along the way. Oily. Sweet, honeyed fruits and a rush of cream, then baked apple tart with extra apple skins and flecks of spice. The sweet nuttiness from the nose is present too. Dry and short, with notes of hazelnuts, brioche and honeysuckle.

name: Glenfiddich 12 Year Old
nose: Distinctively fresh and fruity with a hint of pear. Beautifully crafted and delicately balanced.
finish: A long smooth and mellow finish.
reviews: Glenfiddich 12 is definitely not flamboyant, excessive or fighting for your attention. For me it's an effortless excellence without a big ego, achieving more with less means. || I have tried this product. It's amazing. || Easy drink, light sweet, fruity and grassy single malt. Worth it if you can get it on offer. || Clean and very sweet || Just had a few glasses tonight. Very nice whiskey but lacks complexity. If you just want something “smooth” with a fruity taste pick up a bottle. I’m not a fan of overly strong or heavy drinks so this is perfect for me but more experienced drinkers may find it too basic.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Apple, Pear, Cream, Butterscotch Distinctively fresh and fruity with a hint of pear. Beautifully crafted and delicately balanced. A long smooth and mellow finish.

name: Mortlach 20 Year OldCowie's Blue Seal
characters: Clove, Raisins, Apple, Dates, Milk Chocolate, Dried Fruit
nose: Super dense and rich, with touches of floor polish and much more of the waxy, earthy, meaty element seen in the previous examples. This has real elegance and complexity - and little intrigue. There is an added oiliness which you only get from mature whiskies. This in turn moves into varnish, leather oil, wood resins and even a touch of dubbin. The sensation is like being in some ancient, mysterious, library. There are dried fruits, a touch of scented wood, fir trees, cedar, Moroccan leather, slightly foxed books, floor polish, and some ink. It grows in the glass, moving towards chanterelle mushroom/cep mushroom even some of the wax crayon also seen on the 12-year-old. Huge, highly complex and contemplative.
palate: The mature depth seen on the nose comes immediately into focus, but before it goes towards the dark there’s a refreshing lift of aromatic and overripe fruits (quince especially) and a touch of spiciness. It then expands as the fruits dry and the oils start to coat the tongue. The meaty element comes in quickly here, full-on grunt with animalic edges, cured leather and light bitter notes that bring to mid nutshell, espresso crema, damson jam, cacao nibs all balanced with some hedgerow berry fruits meaning that the back palate has a brighter lift than you might expect from something which is so dense and meaty (think of a berry sauce with venison). As it develops so this back palate shows more roasting tin elements, some bark. It continues to extend into dried fruits.
finish: Quite dense. It carries on seamlessly from the progression seen on the palate with liquorice and dried fruit.
reviews: I tried this product at the last whisky show and I liked it. Until I tried the 16 year old, which I liked a lot more. Rather than buying a 20yo, I sooner but 2 bottles of the 16yo and have enough left over for a bottle of Clynelish 24yo. || A great sip, and a lovely mildly sherried Speyside. But, it still can't seem to match the epic style and purity of the original Mortlach bottlings from a decade ago. || We have thoroughly enjoyed our introduction to Mortlach through the 16 year Flora and Fauna series first discovered on a visit to Edinburgh several years ago where it was compared to a Macallan's 25 at the shop, to the Mortlach 16 and on .....to the Mortlach 20. This continues our love for the distillery's products and the taste, smell and palate that is put into each cask and eventually in the bottle. We only wish we could tour the distillery when we visit Scotland late April/early May 2023. || We have thoroughly enjoyed our introduction to Mortlach through the 16 year Flora and Fauna series first discovered on a visit to Edinburgh several years ago where it was compared to a Macallan's 25 at the shop, to the Mortlach 16 and on .....to the Mortlach 20. This continues our love for the distillery's products and the taste, smell and palate that is put into each cask and eventually in the bottle. We only wish we could tour the distillery when we visit Scotland late April/early May 2023.
flavour_note: Clove, Raisins, Apple, Dates, Milk Chocolate, Dried Fruit Super dense and rich, with touches of floor polish and much more of the waxy, earthy, meaty element seen in the previous examples. This has real elegance and complexity - and little intrigue. There is an added oiliness which you only get from mature whiskies. This in turn moves into varnish, leather oil, wood resins and even a touch of dubbin. The sensation is like being in some ancient, mysterious, library. There are dried fruits, a touch of scented wood, fir trees, cedar, Moroccan leather, slightly foxed books, floor polish, and some ink. It grows in the glass, moving towards chanterelle mushroom/cep mushroom even some of the wax crayon also seen on the 12-year-old. Huge, highly complex and contemplative. The mature depth seen on the nose comes immediately into focus, but before it goes towards the dark there’s a refreshing lift of aromatic and overripe fruits (quince especially) and a touch of spiciness. It then expands as the fruits dry and the oils start to coat the tongue. The meaty element comes in quickly here, full-on grunt with animalic edges, cured leather and light bitter notes that bring to mid nutshell, espresso crema, damson jam, cacao nibs all balanced with some hedgerow berry fruits meaning that the back palate has a brighter lift than you might expect from something which is so dense and meaty (think of a berry sauce with venison). As it develops so this back palate shows more roasting tin elements, some bark. It continues to extend into dried fruits. Quite dense. It carries on seamlessly from the progression seen on the palate with liquorice and dried fruit.

name: Macallan A Night on Earth in Jerez2024 Release
reviews: Outstanding ?? || Excellent tasting whisky

name: Dailuaine 16 Year OldFlora & Fauna
reviews: Delicious, not too sweet and well rounded.

name: Benrinnes 200912 Year Old Sherry Cask The Whisky Exchange
characters: Toffee, Apple, Sultana, Coffee, Hazelnut, Grape
nose: Buttery apple pie and toffee apples to start, all bathed in sticky caramel sauce. Big green apple notes build, dowsed with vanilla cream. Hints of sultana and nectarine develop, along with sweet grapes and a touch of muscovado sugar.
palate: Creamy vanilla toffee and the sharp apples from the nose lead to creamy coffee and baking spice: cinnamon and clove. The toffee continues to build along with touches of hazelnut and crunchy spun sugar.
finish: Hazelnuts and cinnamon spice fade to reveal vanilla toffee and green apple.
reviews: Really wonder full smell, good taste and long pleasant finish. The little smoke from the beginning just for the improvement of the smell taste and finish. My rate above 90. It is good choice for this price, unfortunately limited edition
flavour_note: Toffee, Apple, Sultana, Coffee, Hazelnut, Grape Buttery apple pie and toffee apples to start, all bathed in sticky caramel sauce. Big green apple notes build, dowsed with vanilla cream. Hints of sultana and nectarine develop, along with sweet grapes and a touch of muscovado sugar. Creamy vanilla toffee and the sharp apples from the nose lead to creamy coffee and baking spice: cinnamon and clove. The toffee continues to build along with touches of hazelnut and crunchy spun sugar. Hazelnuts and cinnamon spice fade to reveal vanilla toffee and green apple.

name: Aberlour 16 Year Old Double Cask(40%)
reviews: Yes I was given a bottle of the 14 year old for my 80th birthday. From the very first sip I felt I was in Heaven. || A gem of a single malt. Rich and smooth with a strong tang of toffee. A bit more expensive than the standard 12 year old, but worth it for the increase in quality. || Absolutely love this whisky and it has been my staple drink for a while now. Nothing more enjoyable than sitting back and relaxing with this intoxicating dram. || Everyone has different tastes, but for me this is one of the best whiskies I've ever had, bought for me as Christmas present by a legend. Smooth as silk, wonderful mid and after taste, burn on the way down is warm and not offensive. This is a wonderful wee dram – highly recommend. || A very interesting 16 year old whisky.. Very warm and creamy. Nice and satisfying finish
flavour_note: Toffee, Raisins, Cinnamon, Milk Chocolate

name: Mortlach 200321 Year Old Bourbon Cask Signatory for TWE
characters: Vanilla, Hazelnut, Almond, Candied peel, Dried Fruit, Pineapple
nose: Salted butter, a little dry cured ham, and fruity notes of crab apple jelly and pineapple. Then candied walnuts, peanuts and hazelnuts.
palate: Shortbread, stewed apples and pears, plum wine, toffee, pineapple cubes, and ginger beer. That spiciness persists with cassia, turmeric, and a prickle of dry oak.
finish: The creamy toffee notes stay on the palate along with bags of roasted nuts and dried stone fruit.
flavour_note: Vanilla, Hazelnut, Almond, Candied peel, Dried Fruit, Pineapple Salted butter, a little dry cured ham, and fruity notes of crab apple jelly and pineapple. Then candied walnuts, peanuts and hazelnuts. Shortbread, stewed apples and pears, plum wine, toffee, pineapple cubes, and ginger beer. That spiciness persists with cassia, turmeric, and a prickle of dry oak. The creamy toffee notes stay on the palate along with bags of roasted nuts and dried stone fruit.

name: Craigellachie 201410 Year Old 100 Proof Exceptional #39 Signatory
characters: Caramel, Meat, Black Pepper, Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Oak
flavour_note: Caramel, Meat, Black Pepper, Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Oak

name: Macallan Classic Cut2024 Release
characters: Lemongrass, Sponge cake, Pear, Nutmeg, Oak, Milk Chocolate
flavour_note: Lemongrass, Sponge cake, Pear, Nutmeg, Oak, Milk Chocolate

name: Cardhu 18 Year Old
characters: Milk Chocolate, Cherry, Coffee, Mint, Pear
nose: Not forward, yet attractively ‘natural’ and in time rich, balanced and very complex. Macerated fruits; pears, plums, cherries. Hints of pineapple develop a light, green, gooseberry-like edge. Delicate scents of wild rose, menthol and polished leather rise above a soft base of Christmas cake or buttery pastry. Water opens it all up elegantly, without altering the main themes.
palate: A smooth and sweet taste, unctuous, yet with light and lively acidity. The soft, delicate, fruity core is cradled by rich, chocolate-edged flavours, the texture, chocolate and fruit combining to evoke a cherry liqueur chocolate truffle. Warming overall, it’s softer with water, when the balance of tastes remains the same, though lighter.
finish: Exciting and complex, the conclusion is long, smooth, gently drying and rich in cocoa.
reviews: Let me start by saying that I am not a whisky expert, but I do enjoy The Cardhu. Found it with the Gold reserve, extended with the 12 year old found in Gibraltar, and most recently the 18 year old. I do enjoy sipping a smooth whisky with a taste that I personally find enjoyable, and this has such a depth, it is excellent. Will be enjoyed in the future. || Really lovely smooth but also rich woody18 year old. Also, a great price for a 18 year old Soeyside of this quality.. Very underrated and great value compared to the big 4 (Macallan, Glenmorangie, Glenlivet and Glenfiddich) ??. || I am so disappointed about this drink, it tasted thin and perfumy. It was nothing compared to the 3cl I bought to try, which was malty, woody, rich and sweet! rip off! || Truly INCREDIBLE! I only wish I could buy it in the USA. I brought two bottles back with me from Scotland. The distillery tour was AWESOME too! || Love the spiciness and finish of this whisky. Lovely everyday whisky!
flavour_note: Milk Chocolate, Cherry, Coffee, Mint, Pear Not forward, yet attractively ‘natural’ and in time rich, balanced and very complex. Macerated fruits; pears, plums, cherries. Hints of pineapple develop a light, green, gooseberry-like edge. Delicate scents of wild rose, menthol and polished leather rise above a soft base of Christmas cake or buttery pastry. Water opens it all up elegantly, without altering the main themes. A smooth and sweet taste, unctuous, yet with light and lively acidity. The soft, delicate, fruity core is cradled by rich, chocolate-edged flavours, the texture, chocolate and fruit combining to evoke a cherry liqueur chocolate truffle. Warming overall, it’s softer with water, when the balance of tastes remains the same, though lighter. Exciting and complex, the conclusion is long, smooth, gently drying and rich in cocoa.

name: Glenfarclas 105°
characters: Christmas Cake, Liquorice root, Prunes, Dates
nose: Complex, oaky, apples and pears, and a tempting dark toffee sweetness.
finish: Amazingly smooth for the strength; wonderfully warming and with a lingering smokiness, yet very rounded.
reviews: Holy Hell…this is my new fav dram! Such a bang for your hard earned cash! I first tried 105 in The Ben Mhor Hotel Bar in Grantown Upon Spey and have never looked back. It’s got superlative balance with just the right dryness but depth of flavour and wonderful minerality that seeps down deep into your chest. I had some concern that it the alcohol would burn but so so wrong…this is fine whisky at its finest (in my humble view) and scouring is absent replaced instead by a subtle honey sweetness…and I mean subtle, making this very deliciously drinkable. An absolute bucket list dram if ever there was one and I challenge any to disagree without trying it first. I think at least 8-10years aged and don’t let the alcohol content scare you. Bold, but in totally the right way :) || OMG. Strong Strong Strong, but very nice, needs a touch of water to release more of the flavours. Buy Buy Buy || I like strength & strong whisky. || I’ve had about 6 bottles (not all at once) over the years and, buy when I see it. The nose, is eye watering and is very complex in tasting, I take it with a teaspoon or perhaps a bit more water. All I can say is I’ve just bought another bottle the other day and am looking forward to Christmas when I’ll share it for my friends. I also have five more whiskies, mainly from Isla, my first love. || Definitely need some water to feel the different aromas. Is perfect after heavy Christmas lunch and you need to try it.
flavour_note: Christmas Cake, Liquorice root, Prunes, Dates Complex, oaky, apples and pears, and a tempting dark toffee sweetness. Amazingly smooth for the strength; wonderfully warming and with a lingering smokiness, yet very rounded.

name: Linkwood 201310 Year Old The Seasons: Spring
characters: Wildflowers, Lemon, Vanilla, Cream, Peardrops, Honeycomb
nose: Pears, greengages, lime leaves, honeysuckle, lemongrass, spearmint, fresh linen sheets, green apple sweets and a Gin Gimlet. The American oak influence is subtle, bringing vanilla custard, peppermint creams and desiccated coconut.
palate: Limoncello, yuzu sake, juicy fruit chewing gum, cloudy apple juice and spearmint. There’s also a floral side, with orange blossoms, lilacs, and elderflowers followed by grass lawns after a rain shower.
finish: Vanilla pods and some good salted butter, then subtly spicy with white pepper, celery seed and fennel pollen.
flavour_note: Wildflowers, Lemon, Vanilla, Cream, Peardrops, Honeycomb Pears, greengages, lime leaves, honeysuckle, lemongrass, spearmint, fresh linen sheets, green apple sweets and a Gin Gimlet. The American oak influence is subtle, bringing vanilla custard, peppermint creams and desiccated coconut. Limoncello, yuzu sake, juicy fruit chewing gum, cloudy apple juice and spearmint. There’s also a floral side, with orange blossoms, lilacs, and elderflowers followed by grass lawns after a rain shower. Vanilla pods and some good salted butter, then subtly spicy with white pepper, celery seed and fennel pollen.

name: Aberlour Casg Annamh
characters: Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Ginger, Dried Fruit, Raisins, Toffee
reviews: Big flavour, vanilla and almond that fades slowly leaving and orange peel tang finish. Sweet without being sickly. Highly recommend. || Very very good,6 stars || An excellent dram, equal in taste and quality to its stablemate A’Bunadh || New to Aberlour as a brand , but I must say a stunning hit of smooth richness with consistent strength, aged well with a balanced taste on the palette. Notes of pecan and dried fruits . Finally finished with a gentle warmth like no other I’ve tasted. . I’m glad I choose this version as a introduction to Aberlour.
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Ginger, Dried Fruit, Raisins, Toffee

name: Benromach 21 Year Old
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Raspberry, Smoke, Orange, Honey

name: Glenfarclas 25 Year Old
characters: Hazelnut, Fruit Cake, Dark Chocolate, Coffee
reviews: This is a lovely malt that must be respected for its age. However, having tried most of the Glenfarclas range, the 15 is the one if you want a lovely sherried malt. The 105 is also excellent but at high proof. || Cracker of a dram even at 43% abv but not worth the price in my humble opinion || Very good value, and really enjoyable to add a new taste to our collection. I still prefer the Tomatin 18 year old and the Auchroisk 10 year old. However, here is another Speyside that does not disappoint. || Great price well balanced. This will be my third bottle || A sherry Cask matured scotch that doesn't have the strongest feature of sherry cask - rich fruitiness and sweetness. But still, love it 5/5
flavour_note: Hazelnut, Fruit Cake, Dark Chocolate, Coffee

name: Glenallachie 17 Year OldMasters of Wood: Mizunara and Oloroso
characters: Cinnamon, Pastries, Walnut, Dark Chocolate, Earth
reviews: Amazing dram, which I’d struggle to fault. The cask play is exceptional.
flavour_note: Cinnamon, Pastries, Walnut, Dark Chocolate, Earth

name: Speyside (M) 200518 Year Old Signatory for Whisky Show 2024
characters: Dates, Dried Fruit, Walnut, Milk Chocolate
reviews: crazy aroma, will blow your mind. Had this for a Christmas dinner with my dad a few of his friends, all blown away. Great choice for any Whisky appreciaters' gathering
flavour_note: Dates, Dried Fruit, Walnut, Milk Chocolate

name: Glenallachie 9 Year Old Oloroso Sherry Cask FinishThe Wood Collection

name: Meikle Toir 5 Year Old The Original
characters: Vanilla, Honey, Peat smoke, Apple, Lemon, Black Pepper
reviews: Really liked this , normally I stick to Isaly Malts but this was a really nice drink at this price point , a great balance of sweet richness and smoky peat flavour. I’d recommend !
flavour_note: Vanilla, Honey, Peat smoke, Apple, Lemon, Black Pepper

name: Glenlivet 15 Year OldFrench Oak Reserve
reviews: Not for me, bit harsh || Nose seems muted, palate is creamy, finish a little peppery. All in all not a bad dram || his is one of the malts I keep going back to, really enjoy the influence of the French oak casks. Color is a deep gold, amber. Nose is fruity, I get raisins and ripening apples, oak is rich. On the palate I can taste dried fruits, cinnamon, but not overpowering. Finish is where I think this one shines (I thinks so anyway). Nice long dry finish, peppery, honey sweetness comes through, a bit more oak, at times some caramel. Leaves a long lasting satisfying flavor despite have a medium body feel. Only wish that ABV was a bit higher. || Not a bad dram, slightly harsh tasting initslly. Floral & toffee notes, wouldn’t personally buy after having the sample. Would rather have The Dalmore 15 which for me is in a different league || This is a wonderfully smooth quality malt whisky at a surprisingly good price for one this good.
flavour_note: Almond, Dried Fruit, Butter Creamy, rich, buttery. Fruit and nut. Lingering, sweet almond and spice.

name: Tamnavulin Double Cask
characters: Orange, Ginger, Oak, Apple, Toffee, Milk Chocolate
reviews: This is a very good whisky. I rate it highly. It has a depth and unusual complexity that is a favourite with sophisticated palates and lovers of Speyside in our household. A treat! || Extremely nice and pleasant whisky || I recently purchased this when I noticed it was priced at £24 at the local Co-op. I was initially skeptical due to the cost, but I must say, it tasted v good for the price. Comparing it to a Glenfiddich 12 at £40, this is a commendable option for a budget whiskey. || Not good, aroma bland and taste is terrible. Like a cheap blended spirit. No taste, no warmth ….a very forgetful disappointing experience || I recently bought this for a banger of a price and tried it yesterday - it's not a rich whiskey by any means but you got to factor in the price - its sweet - a typical Speyside - the colour is nice even though its fully artificial - as per the price again - not much of a headache even though I drank a fair bit of it.Overall ,you can't really go wrong with this- if you get it on the cheap.It's the type of whisky you won't notice - either thats good or bad depending on what you're used to drinking. Strong 3 or a light 4 stars is my overall rating basically due to the price.
flavour_note: Orange, Ginger, Oak, Apple, Toffee, Milk Chocolate

name: Balvenie 15 Year OldMadeira Cask
flavour_note: Honeycomb, Dates, Butterscotch, Raisins, Cinnamon

name: Glenlossie 201212 Year Old 100 Proof Edition #35 Signatory

name: Aberlour A'Bunadh
flavour_note: Walnut, Nougat, Orange, Cinnamon

name: Balvenie 17 Year OldWeek of Peat
characters: Smoke, Honey, Heather, Orange, Cream, Oak
reviews: I am a big fan of Balvenie as a Speyside and also of Isla y malts. These things are always subjective however I feel that in this case the pieat overwhelms the delicate flavours of Balvenie. On the other hand, it’s nice to get a flavour of what Speyside may have been like many moons ago.
flavour_note: Smoke, Honey, Heather, Orange, Cream, Oak

name: Linkwood 201014 Year Old Bolgheri Cask
reviews: Unusual and distinctive, very good || 14 yo Linkwood is a delicious malt whisky. Sweet fruits, floral notes and medium body from the Bolgheri casks. A great value whisky || this has always been my favourite, pity it's one of the few distilories that dos not do tours
flavour_note: Raspberry, Meat, Wildflowers, Prunes, Matchbox

name: Benrinnes 15 Year OldFlora & Fauna
reviews: Pleasant if a little simple. Not overly complex. Having experimented I think it is nicer as a before dinner sharpener. The first few drams were very sweet and little else. The bottle opened up after a while. The flavour reminds me of a common blend, Bells or Teachers or one of those, but with more body and sweetness. I initially thought I would not get any more then I bought a second bottle, one is allowed to change. one's mind! It is smooth, lots of body, sweetish and enjoyable. Makes a pleasant change from chewing a heavy Islay malt. || This is hands down one of the best Scotches I have ever had in my life (and I've had a lot). It's so well-balanced, complex, smooth, sweet....it's as good as it gets! I can't believe the majority of this distillery's Scotch goes to some blended whiskey. Everyone I have shared this with also completely loved it. Giving this Scotch 5 stars does not do it justice.....sooo incredible!! || After the Linkwood of the same range Flora and Fauna , again this is a great dram. It maybe 43%, but clings to you're glass, loads of florals and deep fruits. For the money good buy.

name: Aberlour 18 Year Old
characters: Sherry, Raisins, Cherry, Cinnamon, Christmas Cake
nose: Rich and complex, milk chocolate and butterscotch combine with ripe peach and orange zest.
palate: Perfect structure - initial notes of soft apricot and cream offset by developing flavours of liquorice and oak with a touch of honey.
finish: Very long and balanced, progresses from creme brulee to a gentle oak flourish.
reviews: Excellent stuff || Very good one this..full bodied and rich and complex flavours.Best Aberlour I've tasted yet..even better than I remember from a few months ago!?? || One of my new favorite || very smooth and easy to drink with a splash of water, I find that I can unpack more flavour with smaller sips of this exceptional whisky || Not bad certainly with nice mellow cereal aromas and light sherry notes but not a huge step up from the 10 y.o. for me. I much prefer ther A'Bunadh
flavour_note: Sherry, Raisins, Cherry, Cinnamon, Christmas Cake Rich and complex, milk chocolate and butterscotch combine with ripe peach and orange zest. Perfect structure - initial notes of soft apricot and cream offset by developing flavours of liquorice and oak with a touch of honey. Very long and balanced, progresses from creme brulee to a gentle oak flourish.

name: Speyside Single Malt 201012 Year Old PX Finish Ferg and Harris
Strathmill 201212 Year Old 100 Proof Edition #36 Signatory
